Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Location, and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Danstraindepot
Reviews.Content: Wow, a little slice of paradise. Amazing location, excellent rooms. Great food. Staff is incredible. For example, when we arrived they had shown we were arriving the NEXT week. We were staying 5 nights in a Michigan Ave Suite on the 30th floor. SOMEHOW I had put in for the wrong dates! (Traveling too much I suppose) Anyhow, without skipping a beat they had us in the correct room. Great hotel for the kids, the tent they set up in the room and the Candy Man were both big hits (ask for these). Room service was great, high quality. Our suite was HUGE. The hotel is a bit on the older side perhaps, but superbly maintained so that did not bother us a bit. We ended up seeing a bunch of NBA stars in the lobby, so my older son got a big kick out of that. Oh and it is attached to a great mall. So all in all, a bit expensive, but very much worth it. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service makes up for the dated design”
Reviews.Author: FMUBSU
Reviews.Content: The Ritz certainly has an incredible location! It was a tranquil escape from the crazy throngs of people over St. Patrick's Day weekend. We had two adjoining suites with friends which was very convenient. The service was impeccable. The concierge was particularly helpful and efficient. The staff was very friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. The restaurant had wonderful food and terrific service. The only issue with service was there was no evening turndown service which is a cardinal sin at a Four Seasons! The only weakness of the hotel was the suite itself. The huge windows brought in a great deal of light which was wonderful. It was also very well maintained and spacious. That is where the superlatives for the room end. This Four Seasons could be renamed the Four Decades. The wallpaper was from the 1960['s (at least the style) and I swear it came from my grandparent's wallpaper and paint store. The curtains were from the 1970's and had to come from my great aunt's Florida condo. The furnishings were from the 1980's and the bathroom was from the 1990's. The bathroom had a shower/tube combination with a shower curtain. (Yes, a Four Seasons bathroom had a shower curtain!) YUCK! Except for the carpet and the flat screen TV's, there was no hint of anything contemporary in the room. The Four Seasons Chicago caters to well paid businessmen and rich housewives who either don’t care in the case of the former or decorate their 1980 McMansions in the same manner in the case of the latter, so most people will have no issue with the decor. The gym was very large, air conditioned and had a good deal of high quality equipment. The access to Water Tower Place was very convenient. You cannot find a better location in Chicago as it is centrally located along the Magnificent Mile. Be prepared to pay a whopping parking fee of $52/night. A garage adjacent to the hotel has parking for $28/night but it fills up quickly! We were very fortunate to snag the complimentary hotel limo to take us up to North Halsted for a show. We got a decent deal on the hotel and have no regrets. This hotel is stuffy, pretentious and dated (despite the "refreshing" designed by my grandmother's Bridge club), but it does have top notch service, a great location and is obviously well maintained with quality materials.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: CDM1
Reviews.Content: What a place. Service absolutely fantastic from start to finish, great location, fab room and just THE most comfortable bed. Location great and all in all one I'd definitely recommend. More than I'd normally pay but worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale affordable accommodations”
Reviews.Author: decaydoc
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is one block off of Michigan Avenue and easily accessible to up scale shopping. Also it is connected to the 8 story Water Tower Place which is a fabulous shopping mall. The concierge had numerous suggestions for quant, intimate restaurants close by. There was a spectacular view of Navy Pier and the lakes from the room.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay at the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Roger A
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend in Chicago at the Ritz Carlton. The room was great and the location of the hotel was perfect for our needs. I was attending a meeting at the Ritz Carlton and they did a fabulous job with the room set up and the food. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: 2banadventurer
Reviews.Content: The staff at the hotel do everything they can to make your stay personalized and special. We received an email about one week before our stay and were asked about room preferences. They were able to accommodate all of our requests.

Reviews.Title: “A Four Seasons By Any Other Name...”
Reviews.Author: Andrew C
Reviews.Content: For Valentine's Day we popped up to Chicago for the night to enjoy a night at the Ritz Carlton Chicago, a Four Seasons Hotel. We love Four Seasons properties and love staying with them and Mandarin Oriental. We didn't think we could go wrong with a stay at the RC Chicago since it is actually managed by Four Seasons. Our experience was just ok. From the minute we walked up to the lower lobby I had a feeling that things were a little different for this stay. The bellmen neither held the door nor even acknowledge the fact that we were approaching the valet entrance with two large duffel bags on our shoulder's. I had to actually say "good morning" to them. This is way out of character for a Four Seasons. We struggled to find the elevator to the upper lobby as no one was at the valet desk to direct us. We found the upper lobby and got checked in. Check-in was pleasant and efficient even though the hotel was very busy. Our suite was not available but they promised they would text us when it was. We ventured out into the city and came back a few hours later when the room was prepared. We stayed in the Michigan Avenue Executive Suite which was nice and spacious. I was disappointed at no Keurig or small coffee maker in the room and no visible coffee in the lobby anywhere. The bathroom was also less than stellar. One giant vanity with a powder area and one small sink accompanied by plastic vanity accessories. Somewhat tacky in my opinion. The bathroom was a shower/tub combo inside the water closet area. The bathroom was not as the pictures on their website depicted at all. The view from the room was beautiful, especially at night. We got ready for dinner and left the ironing board, etc. out and figured turn down would take care of it. Our dinner experience was far less than adequate, you can read about it in Deca Chicago's reviews here on Tripadvisor. We returned to our room to find that turn down was never done and the ironing board, etc. was all still left out. Disappointed. We headed down to the spa area to enjoy the hot tub a bit before bed since we had to cancel our other plans in the city due to dinner taking so long. The young lady at the spa desk was very abrasive and somewhat rude. When we asked how to access the pool area, she looked us up and down and said "are you swimming or looking?" To this I replied, we had our swimsuits on under our dress clothes. She said "sign in, you have twenty minutes." I looked at my partner in disgust and commented that the Four Seasons in Las Vegas had much more decorum in their spa area. The pool and hot tub was very nice and is enclosed by a large sky light. We met some nice travelers in the area and spent a while conversing with them. We made sure to not use up the 20 minutes and headed to the locker rooms. Locker room areas were nice and adequately equipped. This is also a Carlton Club so there is a lot of outside members who use the facilities in addition to the hotel guests. Breakfast the next morning was hot, delicious, and on time. The room service waiter was cheerful and very charming. I explained our dissatisfaction with the check in attendant at checkout and she assured me that the hotel manager would want to speak with me regarding the issues. Several days later, I received a call from Anthony, the hotel manager, who assured me this was a one off situation and welcomed us back anytime to try again at letting the Ritz Carlton "wow" us. We are headed back in May and we have high hopes that the second try will be the winning one. What a beautiful classic property, I would love for it to meet the expectations of all Four Seasons' travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, great service, first class”
Reviews.Author: Pamela J
Reviews.Content: Excellent service and great amenities for kids. Impressed with the standards they hold and will return for sure! Have visited twice, once with children and once without. Both times were great!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfet Suite”
Reviews.Author: marky01095
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton at Water Tower Place, is everything a Ritz Carlton should be. Nothing was overlooked, great staff, beautiful property. Great Bar and Brunch. Our suite was large and exactly as promised. The location of the Ritz Carlton on Pearson is Ideal. Very happy with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in the heart of Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Ancon
Reviews.Content: First time visit to the Ritz Carlton Chicago, travel with wife and 3 kids. We had 2 deluxe adjoing rooms, very confortable beds (Four Seasons Bed), good size rooms, ample bathroom with premium amenities. Service at the highest standard - Four Seasons - always with a smile and ready to help. The lobby area has a beautiful water fountain that provides serenity and peace while having breakfast nearby or enjoying a drink in the bar, also next to the fountain. The hotel is on top of a mall with 100+ stores, with a few restaurants and deli's in the base floor. Everything is close to the hotel, restaurants, BestBuy, American Girl store. Its like being in 5th Ave N.Y., without the noise and hasle of N.Y., very quiet city with nice and respectful people. We enjoyed the Ritz Carlton and would recommend to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, very helpful Concierge Desk”
Reviews.Author: oceanman18
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife love to stay at the Ritz when we are in town, I am a frequent Four Seasons customer and this hotel has been always on top of my list. Laurel and Jon helped us out with our dinner reservations and the show tickets(Million Dollar Quartet), they were both awesome as usual. The hotel is conveniently located by Michigan Avenue and very easy to access everywhere in the city. We heard that the Sunday brunch is no longer served and the 5 high tea service is now served at the restaurant. According to my wife she the tea service was not the same and the old location of the high tea service was better.

Reviews.Title: “I have no idea as to what the purpose of this box is !!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jerome S
Reviews.Content: Everything was great except finding that someone had gone through my car. At first I was going to leave my GPS in the car but then decided to take it with me. I'm happy I did !

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: KMLaing
Reviews.Content: This 5 star property is located adjacent to-and attached to-the Water Tower Place Shopping Mall. The property is as it should be for a 5 star-great service, impressive rooms, unforgettable beds with awesome pillows, and gorgeous public rooms. The cocktail area has much improved since the recent renovation of the 7th floor Reception area. The heron fountain in the Lobby has been the sight of many family photos & romantic rendezvous. The Chicago Museum of Modern Art is across the street, Eli Schulman Park is across the street (named after the inventor of Eli's Cheesecakes), the historic Chicago Water Tower is steps away, as well as world-class shopping and restaurants galore. Of particular interest to some is the American Dental Association building located just across the park, with it's interesting displays of antique dental equipment. You can't go wrong staying at the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay as usual.”
Reviews.Author: SJZValrico
Reviews.Content: I stay at this property two to three times a year and they are very consistent. Very good attention to detail by their staff. Rooms are very nice, kept very well and turned down in the evening for you. No better place to stay when in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Jinx223
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favourite hotels in chicago and i think that it is the best in service and the food they have there. Also they have the biggest rooms in the city i think. I would always reccomend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chicago for sure”
Reviews.Author: Courtt1
Reviews.Content: Still one of the top 10 Hotels in the USA and possibly the WORLD! Great ambience, great staff, great service, Concierge Staff to handle every need and whim, and great location. What else can I say excpet its been totally renovated so it's like a new Hotel, too!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, gorgeous hotel. Worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: Nancy S
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay. They offer very personalized service. Kids are important guests to them also. Our room was beautiful. Some of the best customer service I have ever received at a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite what I come to expect from RC”
Reviews.Author: DeansDesk
Reviews.Content: I am a frequent RC customer and think the brand is excellent. This location being managed by the Four Season raised my expectations even more. Some of my review may seem tick-tack but it does distinguish this location from others in a less favorable light and therefore is worthy of mention: 1. The lobby is huge and the water fountain gives it appeal but it all gets lost with a certain lack of intimacy. The seats at the windows are high-back chairs which serve to interrupt the aesthetics and view in my opinion. The rock ledge outside the windows is unattractive. I had expected the same feel you get at the Mandarin Oriental in NYC or the Four Seasons in Miami. This isn't in that league. 2. The small bar in the lobby has no TV. There is no other bar anywhere in the hotel. Big swing and miss. 3. The lobby restaurant is a bit cold and antiseptic, large spacious open area, like eating at an indoor food court. Harsh? Maybe. Food was good. 4. Service: RC employees alwasy use your name when addressing you. It's what you come to expect. That is not the case here and I found that to be revealing. 5. Rooms were about what you would expect at an RC. 6. Location, excellent as reported but so are a huge number of other hotels in Chicago. Overall, I would not stay here again and that's the first RC I can say that about, really, yet, I can see the appeal if you haven't tasted other RC locations.

Reviews.Title: “Location spot on, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: simcfro
Reviews.Content: Excellent location just off Michigan. Some great views of the lake and the city if you get the right room. Service is excellent, rooms are beautiful, breakfast is very good but not cheap (you're not here on a budget right?) and the bar is nice and relaxing, even if it closes too early. A bit of a treat.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: patrickwNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in Chicago 9 times & I must go out a say 1 thing first: It's truly the best hotel in Chicago & one of the finest hotels on the Mag Mile! As with all Four Seasons Hotels, service is what truly sets apart their properties, as the RC in Chicago is at the pinnacle of this! For a 435 room hotel, the level of service I have received each & every stay is so intimate, warm, knowledgable, efficient & classy. The Front Desk is truly flawless- they have such an amazing team of people, including Kate, Sean, Jennifer, Jackie, Leticia, Christine, Pop....I could go on & on, but after staying here so many times, these amazing people have constantly exceeded my expectations!:) The rooms are really lovely- all beginning on the 15th floor (15-31 I believe) & have everything I need- a great flat screen TV with very clear pictures, large windows with stunning views (my favorite are the Lake View rooms on the 20th floor & higher), roomy bathrooms with a nice soaking tub, fantastic beds (I dream about their beds--so good!), nice mini-bar area, soft carpet, perfect closets (I love the small area on the door where I can hang my coat, shirts, etc.), a spacious desk with complimentary internet with solid speed, & an overall decor that is very soothing & masculine- I love it! The rooms are all incredibly quiet & have large wooden doors- I've never heard street noise, people talking, or any outside noise- much appreciated when traveling! The food from Room Service is amazing! The Salads, Eggs Benedict, Lemon Tart, Sandwiches, etc. are all so yummy! I love Deca, the hotels restaurant, for Lunch or an early dinner- I dined there for dinner over the weekend & it was flawless- the scallops currently featured were delicious! The setting for room service is lovely & their servers are kind & will always greet you warmly & special requests are always accommodated, which I really love. If your craving something that isn't on the menu, the staff will prepare it for you, which is so nice of all Four Seasons Hotels! The Location could not be more perfect. The hotel lobby is actually located on the 12th floor, which I love, as it provides a calmer area for guests to relax in & is very large & open with always stunning floral arrangements that are always a treat to admire:) All of the shopping on the Mag Mile is right outside the door & you have immediate access to amazing dining, shops, the lake, fantastic museums, etc. Just the best area, even though I love all of the neighborhoods of the city! It's the little details that I love most about one of my favorite hotels in the U.S.: the staff always recognizes me by name, my room is always ready for early arrival & housekeeping does an impeccable job of servicing my room~ I could constantly gush about this hotel! I wholeheartedly recommend the hotel! I have stayed at The Peninsula, The Four Seasons (which is great, the RC Chicago's sister hotel), The James, Park Hyatt, etc., but the Ritz-Carlton is just special to me- I just love being there, truly my home in Chicago! Best, Patrick Winkler 31 Jan. 12 --

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: talara
Reviews.Content: Just stayed for one night as our flight was cancelled the day before, snow and ice not a good combination. We rented a car from Alamo, not a great experience but it worked, if we knew the parking was $54 per night, we probably would have taken a cab! We went for a memorial service at the hotel. The room, nice large enough, bathroom great. We were booked in a king but we needed a double no problem, their staff is wonderful. Beds were nice, but the hotel only had down pillows, of course I am the one of us who does not like feather pillows, but I guess I should of asked for others, my fault. The price point was great since we were on a group rate, but I would never pay their published rates, I travel a lot, but it was not to a point I would pay over $300 for the room. The rooms did not have coffee pots which is what we are used to, but have coffee in the lobby till 10 am. Being attached to the shopping mall was great, we ate a couple of meals at the mall, fun and full of people to watch, as it was 26F outside. Did not get a chance to try the pool, so I must pass on telling you anything about it. The memorial service was in a room on the lobby floor, nice remained me of a very nice country club ball room. The brunch was prime rib, eggs Benedict with crab cakes, Cornish game hens, variety of cheese's, yogurt parfait, smoke salmon and bagels, etc. I will have to say the crab cake eggs Benedict were wonderful, the prime rib was not the best, we had some the night before somewhere else that you could cut with your fork even thick cuts. Again, great stay, but I could not give it 5 stars due to my expectations being way to high. I stay a lot in many cities and have stayed at better for a lot less. It might be my price point issues that will not allow me to give it a 5 star. Would I stay again, yes, but not for more than $300 per night and take a cab, their parking is way high.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and penny-pinching”
Reviews.Author: BagsParis_france
Reviews.Content: i was so disappointed by my 3-night visit. It felt neither as a Four Seasons nor a ritz-Carlton (with the exception of their wonderful staff and the good breakfast). The room was old and sparsely furnished. The bathroom among the smallest i have ever seen. The tub (no separate showe) was literally attached to the toile-- you had no option of a hand held shower either. At bed turndown the staff did the bare essentials,-- no water, no chocolate, no rug and slippers, no shutting of curtains. No international TV channels, not even CNN International.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: SuziT3773
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 4 kids to Chicago for the New years Weekend and had a great time at the Ritz-Carlton. They are very accomodating to families with children. Its a beautiful hotel in a great location. I love being attached to the mall. The concierge was wonderful at getting us reservations at the American Girl cafe & the Signature room. The only issues we had were that we could not see the Navy Pier Fireworks from our rooms and that the we had to go through the Spa locker rooms to get to the pool. My son, who is 5 yrs old, had to go through the mens locker room alone (which was a maze) and ended up getting lost and crying. They would not let him go through the womens locker room with me. Other than that is was wonderful & I would reccomend it.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Big city Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jefftimb
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent the New Years Eve weekend at this elegant Hotel. Our Room was perfect. The Restaurants were amazingly good for Hotel food , in fact they ranked high against any Restaurant. The Staff was friendly and very helpful.The location could not have been better to experience down town Chicago. An added bonus were the Holiday decorations and spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: NewPal_TravelFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed there over Labor Day weekend 2011. In 2010 we stayed at the Four Seasons and it was sold out, so we decided to try this one, since it's a sister hotel. We definitely prefer the Four Seasons over this one, but we have no complaints. It was clean, spacious and the staff was friendly. We had a massage at the spa and that was equally as nice. No complaints. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: drmakaplan
Reviews.Content: Overall, a five-start experience during a Christmas family vacation. Other than one extremely poor customer service incident dining at the hotel restaurant...the stay was "perfect." The accommodations in the 2-bedroom suite on the 30th floor were outstanding! Surprisingly, the hotel offered several unique kid-friendly services. I will definitely stay again making sure to avoid one waiter!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Chicago was perfect”
Reviews.Author: porterc
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic weekend as the Chicago Ritz Carlton in a beautiful room with a lake view. Be sure to get a massage in the spa - one of the best I have ever had. Location is great for shopping - walking distance to everything!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for: a truly five-star experience.”
Reviews.Author: data_wrangler_nyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton over New Year's 2012, and it was amazing. The location was perfect, the room was beautiful, the view was fantastic, the service was excellent, the food was delicious, the drinks were intoxicating. Sure, it's expensive, but you get what you pay for, and the Ritz leaves nothing to be desired. The lobby on the 12th floor is beautiful, with a huge marble fountain in the middle, and past that a huge glass-enclosed bar area with a view of the city. I asked about upgrades when I checked in, and despite that they were heavily booked for the holidays, the attendant at reception bumped us up to the 28th floor lake-view room at no additional charge. Our room was large and well-appointed, the bathroom was clean and well-lit, the robes were fluffy and comfy. We spent quite a bit of time in the room, and everything about it was exceptional. Deca, the bar and restaurant, was also great. We had some drinks there, a late-night snack, and breakfast, and I was impressed with the menu and the quality of what we ordered every time. Even the bar snacks -- salted nuts and cured olives -- were delicious enough to bear mentioning. One particular accolade: we had dinner at Gibson's Steakhouse and came back with a ton of leftovers. We got home after a late night -- it was after midnight -- and I asked the concierge if they could help us reheat them somehow. Within fifteen minutes, he sent up a microwave to our room! I didn't even know that was an option. It made me want to ask about other things just to find out what I could have brought up to us for free.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving perfection”
Reviews.Author: RSTT3959
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during Thanksgiving. Hotel was a true 5 star property. Thanksgiving dinner was excellent. Perfect hotel for shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, noisy location”
Reviews.Author: ryanj31
Reviews.Content: Spent New Year's weekend in Chicago and stayed at the Ritz. Nice property, outstanding service (especially Jon the concierge...got us tickets to two sold out shows). Stayed in one of the renovated rooms, it was very nice. I know that city noise is a problem with many hotels in big cities, but the Ritz is located across the street from a fire station and the engines (with sirens blaring) were active all weekend, especially late at night. Even on the 30th floor, it seemed that the fire engine was going right outside our window. Beautiful hotel, great service, but if you stay here, cross your fingers that it will be an emergency-free weekend in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Winter in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Purvis
Reviews.Content: Have been to the Ritz on many occasions, and have always had wonderful experiences. Service is superb, rooms are tastefully decorated and very comfortable, and the location adjacent to Water Tower shopping and Michigan Ave is very convenient. As a luxury hotel, the cost is higher than the majority of local competitors, but in my mind, it's well worth a higher fee.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: letmetrip
Reviews.Content: fantastic location, perfect place to call home for Christmas shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: AnnieofMD
Reviews.Content: I stay at the Ritz frequently on business trips to Chicago. This trip I had a beautiful room on the 29th floor looking northward, which I thoroughly enjoyed. The quality of service, a nice exercise facility, and my great room all contributed to a successful stay. Also, being connected to Water Tower Place (though the shopping isn't as good as it used to be) is very convenient--didn't have to go out in rainy weather to enjoy a few moments of shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar location Lovely ServiceRooms....not so nice!”
Reviews.Author: Ellen K
Reviews.Content: The RC FS is located on top of Water Tower Place..just hop on the elevator and you are immediately transported down into the shopping center! If shopping and people watching are your thing...look no further for the perfect hotel! My early arrival was noted and honored. Room service breakfast came exactly on time. Now...the not so good. Room service delivered a cheese and fruit platter in a cardboard box inside a brown bag....no tray to eat it on and just a very strange way to have room service. Turn down was not even apparent until I discovered the bed pillow in my closet. The bed was messy from me lying on it and had not been smoothed out, the drapes had not been drawn and no mint, no weather update, nothing. There was no book of services in the room, so I had no idea what the hotel offered. The premium King room bathroom was wonderful but the room itself felt like a nice Holiday Inn ....bland, not luxurious nor special. I am a hotel DIVA, I admit this, I want perfection! I may try the other FS next time I head to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, sub par rooms”
Reviews.Author: njudah
Reviews.Content: While the Ritz deserves praise for its location and service, the dated and charmless decor and rooms would be more appropriate of a 4 star sheraton than a 5 star hotel. My two specific concerns are: - Lobby & public spaces: Compared to the other hotels in the area, including the Sofitel and Peninsula - and other top tier Ritz properties such as the Tokyo or Half Moon Bay - the Ritz Chicago seems steril and dated. While the views are nice, the overall space has as much charm as a regional airport. - Bathrooms: I stayed in an executive suite, and given the size of the overall room, I was surprised how cramped the bathroom was. And if you can imagine the kind of bathroom / shower you'd see in a standard 3.5 star hotel, that is unfortunately what you'll get here. Other rooms may have better amenities, but for a suite, its hard not to be disappointed. Some of my favorite hotels in the world are Ritz's, but this one just doesn't measure up. I don't know if they have renovations planned, but I'd look forward to trying this property again if and when they are complete.

Reviews.Title: “CHICAGO ELEGANCE”
Reviews.Author: Anne J
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here after 3 weeks on business/pleasure in Europe and can say with a certainty that the Ritz-Carlton measures up to first class hotels in Paris in a very positive way. The location, view, service and amenities are first rate. The lobby on the 12th floor is one of our favorites, being above the noise and congestion of the North Side of Chicago. Within walking distance of so much Chicago has to offer, yet the hotel is tucked off of busy Michigan Avenue which is a positive. Concierge was most helpful and the staff extra friendly and solicitous. If in Chicago again on business or pleasure, we most definitely would stay here

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: FamOf3_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton for 3 nights and were very pleased. The hotel is lovely, and the location is top-notch - right across the street from the John Hancock building and in the thick of Magnificent Mile shopping. It also has direct access to a large, upscale mall, which is great if you need to pick up gifts or forgotten items, or just want to stretch your legs in inclement weather. Our room was large, comfortable and nicely appointed (ask for a room on a high floor with a view of the lake, if possible). Service is warm, polite and proper without being stuffy, from the parking attendant to the front desk to the housekeeping staff. The only point that could use slight improvement is the bathroom amenities. The shower curtain was the thin, standard sort found in much less expensive hotels; the toilet paper was single-ply; and the hair dryer was showing its age. These are just quibbles, but at this price point I tend to expect higher-quality trappings. Overall, though, we loved the hotel and would absolutely make a repeat visit!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: HappyMichigander
Reviews.Content: When I asked my wife," how many stars should I give the Ritz?" She did not hesitate to say 5. Everybody was so nice to us. The staff makes a constant effort to call you by name, and are always asking if they can help you with anything else. The Ritz Carlton is a wonderful hotel to stay at and be pampered. Location is great being right on the Magnificent Mile. I expect a lot when staying and paying for Four Seasons accommodations and the Ritz certainly delivered. They called ahead to me to see if I needed any help with my trip planning. Service and friendliness are even better than excellent. Bed is great. They do need to update the bathroom showers to 2 heads with more room. I will definitely come back. It was a wonderful relaxing stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: MomakFlorida
Reviews.Content: We visited Chicago over Thanksgiving and were very pleased with all aspects of the hotel. The only crunch was driving down Michigan on the Friday after Thanksgiving! Total traffic madness made us question why we planned this then, but upon arrival we were delighted to enter the lovely lobby on the 12th floor and very pleased with our suites. Great location, great attention to detail and very polite staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay.”
Reviews.Author: Matthieu25
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay. Its a Ritz (kind of) so your high expectations wont be let down. The hotel is ran by Four Seasons, which honestly when I'm in Chicago I prefer but I was traveling with family and they didnt have enough rooms but this is very much on par with every 5 star. Downtown location is great you're really in the middle of it all. They have switched around valet since my last visit which is nice but not clear at all. During our two night stay we were "turned down" only once and that really was just emptying the trash and drawing the drapes. The Four Seasons goes a bit further. We had room service which was great and had breakfast in their restarant twice. If you're a business traveler you may want to pass on their restrant for breakfast, as we found the service VERY slow but the food was great. Thankfully this trip was pleasure and we didnt have a meeting to get to or I can say I would have been very disappointed. Overall it was excellent and I'd stay again in a heartbeat. But as stated when I have the choice I prefer the Four Seasons. Cheers!

Reviews.Title: “Kids first Chicago weekend!”
Reviews.Author: jon111_11
Reviews.Content: this was our first weekend in Chicago with our kids and the Ritz made it all easy and fun. the toy cart made them feel welcome, and the robes let them feel grown up and part of the experience. the waitstaff in the restuarant had smaller kids sized plates and silverware that again made them feel like guests rather than a bother.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly What You Expect When You Combine A Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: mattjb24
Reviews.Content: When you stay at a Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton you expect more to say the least. The hotel staff were amazing! They catered to our every need and actually exceeded my expectations. We stayed in a Lake view Suite which were two rooms and a parlor room with amazing views. The rooms was really nice although the bathrooms still could use a more modern feel to it. Bed was super comfortable. I highly recommend this hotel and room! We were here on business and the hotel provided us with a printer and everything we needed to work out of our hotel room comfortably. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel experience in Chicago bar none.”
Reviews.Author: Jahmala
Reviews.Content: You have to experience the Chicago Ritz to understand. Even my dog is like two paws up!

Reviews.Title: “Great service and perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Craig R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for the Magnificent Mile lighting. The staff went out of their way to keep everyone in our family happy. There were nice little extras for the kids like a toy wagon on our arrival, cookies, gummies and a drink waiting for us at night, kids' toiletries, and robes. The Christmas tree lighting in the lobby was great as well and again very well thought out (hot chocolate in small cups that was cool enough for them to drink right away; it sounds silly, but obviously someone with small kids thought about this). Being above the American Girl store was a highlight for our daughters. The Deca restaurant in the hotel was great for us and again accommodated nicely for our daughters. I'd definitely recommend the Ritz as a great high-end hotel for families with children where the adults can also still be in a luxury setting.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely rooms, excellent staff, relaxing & rejuvenating spa treatments, perfect location on the Magnificent Mile.”
Reviews.Author: Debbie T
Reviews.Content: I recently surprised my husband with a stay at the Ritz Carlton to celebrate his 60th birthday. From the moment we arrived at the valet, their excellent staff made us feel welcome and comfortable. We had a lovely room on the 16 th floor which offered a beautiful view of the city & lake. We enjoyed massages and manicure/pedicures in the spa, and a fabulous afternoon tea service. The hotel sent a decadent piece of chocolate cake and chocolates to the room with their birthday wishes. The hotel is connected to Water Tower Place, which has many great stores to shop in, and is located on the Magnificent mile for even more shopping and great dining. We look forward to our next stay!

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: amh3855
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton sits on top of Water Tower Place right on the Magnificent Mile so the location can't be beat. You take the elevator up and it's like stepping into a little oasis of luxury and calm in the midst of Chicago. Rooms are well done and very comfortable. My room had beautiful views of Lake Michigan which I enjoyed. Great tubs in the bathroom and lots of nice little touches. Very comfortable beds too. The food in the restaurant is excellent and I ate there for several meals while I was there. The only negative was that service in the restaurant was spotty depending on who the assigned server is. The first lunch I had there, I had to make several requests to get a drink, menu and after asking for my check, ended up having to walk over to the desk to ask for my check a second time, although the restaurant was fairly empty. However, the manager was very apologetic going as far as picking up the check and having a bottle of wine sent to my room. He went above and beyond to make it better. Had different servers for other meals which was a big improvement. There is also a nice lobby bar which we enjoyed as well. All in all a very good service experience and a nice luxury property. I would highly recommend staying here and plan to return.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton Chicago; a very ordinary hotel”
Reviews.Author: We-love-great-beaches
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Ritz Carlton over last weekend and found it not to be up to the standard of the other Four Seasons properties we have stayed at. Don't get me wrong, when held up against average standards this hotel is very nice but there were multiple things (although they be individually small) that I would not expect to find at a hotel of this caliber at over $500/night. On the positive side this hotel has an Excellent location, especially for those who are visiting the American Girl Store (the hotel actually has direct access to the entire mall). The service was attentive and generally very good and the public areas of the hotel were very nicely decorated. On the negative side when our room was assigned we were not offered a tour of either the hotel or of our rooms amenities. Upon arriving to the room we were unable to find any literature on the amenities of the hotel (we had to call to the front desk to ask where the ice machine was); would have expected to have ice already in the room and find information on the hotel. The room was only average size for a Chicago luxury hotel in this price range. Our room, on the 20th floor, was an upgraded deluxe room with two double beds. The room had a piece of wallpaper by the window peeling off which I would not expect to find. Our reservation was for 3 guests but our room was only made up with pillows for two, which prompted another call to resolve. Finally, the computer keyboard in the business center was filthy. Taken together, I would not have expected any of these things from a Four Seasons hotel. As an alternative, I would recommend the Elysian Hotel which provides twice the space, a fireplace, luxurious rooms with great features, an in town car that can drop you off in a few block radius all for less than the Ritz. It is 2 blocks from Michigan Avenue but the hotel much makes up for the short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Mamakali
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at this hotel and had a fantastic time. We had an Executive Suite that was on the corner of the building so we ended up with views of Michigan Avenue and the Water Tower, AND the lake and Navy Pier. The room was huge, with a large sitting room, separate bedroom - two tv's etc. My only complaint was that there was only one sink in the bathroom and the bathtub wasn't large. The service at the hotel is top notch - extremely helpful and friendly all round. We had drinks in the bar a couple of times, and there was some great music. Bar prices were reasonable for a Four Seasons, and you have to try the Scotch egg bar snack - just the best!! The location of the hotel was perfect for walking to all the places we wanted to go to, including some fabulous restaurants, but taxis were right there when we needed them. Highly recommended - I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “keep going back”
Reviews.Author: michelle d
Reviews.Content: my husband and i try to come here once a year. we're from chicago and have stayed at numerous hotels in the city. this however is where we go for a special treat to ourselves. beautiful hotel, good food, great proximity for dining and shopping. great service.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: OCC04
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 4 nights in November. The hotel is wonderful. The location is terrific (above a 7 story mall) and the staff is top notch. Upon arrival we were greeted by the doorman and a bellman was immediately dispatched to pick up our luggage. You take the elevator to the 12th floor for registration. The 12th floor is also the location of the gift shop, restaurant, business center and lounge. The 2nd floor is elevator entrance to the Water Tower mall. Upon check in we were greeted by Emily, who remembered us from our reservation call and treated us like family. The deluxe king room we had was on the 29th floor and had a wonderful view of the City and the Navy Pier. The neighborhood was great for walking and shopping. Historic sights and the Miracle Mile of shops were right there. Food in the neighborhood is terrific. The Ritz Cafe is reasonably expensive but excellent for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. The pancakes, hamburgers, and New York strips were fantastic. Room service is quick and the delivery staff is friendly. Mike Ditka's, Don Shula's and many other restaurants are within walking distance. Room cleanliness is critical to my wife and I and this Ritz is spotless. Our room were cleaned meticulously. The furnishings and carpet look like new. A great place to stay. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “great restaurant”
Reviews.Author: bpmurraymd
Reviews.Content: Not just a plain hotel restaurant -- a great place to eat. try it.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: ddeckerdds
Reviews.Content: staff is wonderful. great rooms..esp. lakeviews. lots of excellent restaurants nearby. interior access to watertower mall-shopping

Reviews.Title: “My Chicago home”
Reviews.Author: YachtieUK
Reviews.Content: Nothing but positives. Staff are great, rooms classy and location perfect for Magnificent Mile, Lake and restaurants. Just need to put a coffee maker in the room and it will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Alas, Only Spent One Night”
Reviews.Author: Lemiracle
Reviews.Content: I spent one night here a few Januarys ago and really wish it had been longer. The stay was terrific, but way too short. The lobby is on the 12th floor and opulent, complete with a classy bar and comfortable chairs to take in a terrific city view. The staff, as expected, was very friendly and made a point to make my colleague and I feel very welcome during our stay. I don't have too much experience staying in uber-fancy hotels, so any complaint at all seems trivial. Still, as others have noted, the rooms -- while still very nice -- felt a little old and weren't as over-the-top luxurious as one might have expected. And, of course, this isn't a cheap place to stay. But it's worth it. Chicago is one of the country's truly great cities, and the hotel is perfectly situated for exploring it. You're across the street from the Water Tower, a block from Michigan Ave and two blocks from the lake. I found a great (duh) deep dish pizza place for dinner and followed up with drinks at a sports bar. We also took in a Bulls game at the United Center, which was a fairly easy drive from the hotel. And, even if I won't be staying at the Ritz (in this fiscal climate, my company won't be putting me up there again!), I already can't wait to get back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “First Time at the Ritz....Definitely Coming Back”
Reviews.Author: terrill03
Reviews.Content: Great Location....5 minutes from all shopping on the Magnificant Mile and within walking distance of all the great restaurants. The hotel while not the newest in town is in impeccible condition, it sits on top of a mall, the lobby is actually on the 12th floor. Great hotel staff, always courteous and accomodating. The hotel has all the ammenities you would expect, pool, gym (with actually good equipment, unlike some other hotels) and spa, Guest room was wonderful, had a large room with good lake view , huge bathroom, wonderful linens and premium L'Occitane toiletrees. Highly recommend the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised on the upside”
Reviews.Author: cls31_10
Reviews.Content: Ritz Carlton in Chicago has great service and large rooms. The view out to the water and the ferris wheel is nice. It's close to major department stores and other shopping. For the cost, I was expecting a lot less. I had to stay here as two other more expensive hotels were booked out for a conference. I stayed at one earlier in the year and the Ritz Carlton was actually better.

Reviews.Title: “Kindness and commitment”
Reviews.Author: AATTIE
Reviews.Content: Nice place, wonderful view of the Lake Michigan, staff commitment and kindness. Thank you for a pleasant stay in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid spot for a professional gathering.”
Reviews.Author: Barbara M
Reviews.Content: Attended a limited attendance business strategies program and the Ritz-Carlton was the perfect location. It provided an elegant environment for our discussions of challenges facing our industry. The intellectual stimulation was heightened by the pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Kelly G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in the best location for a first time Chicago visitor! I got up in the morning to run along the water and it was just a short walk to get there (the doorman pointed me in the right direction and even gave me a bottle of water). Being a tourist, I loved that there was a tour bus stop just a half a block away and that we could walk to the sites. The rooms were beautiful and the lobby was absolutely stunning! The staff was extremely helpful and made me feel right at home!

Reviews.Title: “No Brainer”
Reviews.Author: philbyl
Reviews.Content: Great location with impeccable rooms & superior service...worth every dollar and will definitely be returning around the holidays!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property, beautiful views, stellar service.”
Reviews.Author: Alicia A
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with our recent stay at the Ritz-Carlton Chicago. The property is beautiful - the lobby area in particular. Our room was tasteful and well appointed overlooking Lake Michigan. Drinks at the bar were wonderful -- I highly recommend the "Pear Necessity" -- delish. But above all, the service was absolutely stellar. We were called by name, wished a happy anniversary numerous times, and made to feel most welcomed. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “The best service in the city”
Reviews.Author: laura g
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at many luxury hotels in the city and the Ritz by far has the friendliest staff. Love the location too. It's a relaxing but yet fun place to stay. Also great if you'd like to bring the kids too. They are fabulous with kids!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: catlaw98
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on a business trip. The location is fantastic. Able to walk to shops and restraurant with ease. The service is top notch. Very friendly and very helpful. Definitely, pricey, but not surprising given the name.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the name”
Reviews.Author: jenntish
Reviews.Content: Impeccable service--walking down the hall an employee pressed the down button for me since they saw me approaching. Gym was great--peppermint infuse chilled towels!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and great location”
Reviews.Author: LookOut1313
Reviews.Content: We went to Chicago as tourists - and so we found the hotel perfectly situated. Our room which was a deluxe room with a water view was great. It was large enough to comfortably accommodate 4 people and though one had to look sideways for the view, the city scape in front of our window was lovely. The room was very clean and quiet. The bathroom was bit cramped, especially the incredibly small area where the shower was located, it was dangerous for more than one person to be in that room at a time. We found the hotel staff to be friendly and accommodating, particularly at the concierge desk. I agree with another reviewer who described the hotel lobby as a bit tired and dated in terms of decor. Where the hotel was lacking: Coffee and Tea was provided for guests in the reception area; there was not one morning where people weren't waiting for some element (hot water, coffee, cream) to be resupplied. I think one morning I waited close to ten minutes for coffee to arrive. Perhaps coffee makers in the rooms would be a good idea after all. We had two meals in the restaurant and while the food was delicious, the service was unbelievably slow. It took over 60 minutes for us to get our Lunch. For each meal, we must have been sitting there a good ten minutes before any waitperson stopped by our table. I was also puzzled that "turn down" service - neither turned down the bed nor left behind the customary treat. While I thought the Ritz=Carlton was very nice, I think we might look at other options next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Cwynn
Reviews.Content: The location is perfect. Nothing bad to say. Top notch service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Linda H
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel and great views. Our room was spacious and beautifully furnished. Bathroom was huge, with double sinks, mirrored walls, nice amenities. Great location for shopping as it's attached to Water Tower Place.

Reviews.Title: “Not overly impressed”
Reviews.Author: Samwise001
Reviews.Content: I've been to a number of Four Seasons throughout the world and unfortunately I can't rank this as high or even up to par as the others. Was here for a few days for business and just a number of things that made it an ok experience. I had them sync my profile to my reservation, and my wife called to let them know it was my birthday, and usually FS would deliver a small dessert, but nothing. This type of gesture is what sets FS apart from other hotels. As far as ambiance goes, the hotel feels old. Chandelier lighting in the elevator looked dusty, the doors to the room feel like the tarnish is fading, small bathrooms (the shower door swings over the toilet). I'm not used to seeing that from a FS. TV reception went in and out. The spa and pool are small - not really a spa, more like a small semi private gym. As a two lane lap pool, not something kids could just splash around freely. Seems like bldg is shared with apartment owners, and not just hotel guest - saw a lot of people in elevators with dogs. Service not quite consistently there, and never felt that they were over achieving to please. However, hotel is in ideal location. It's connected to a shopping mall, near a lot of stores (i.e. Magnificent Mile), Gino's Pizza, Garretts Popcorn, and a short 15 walk to the Red Line. Concierge and valet were very helpful. To me the true FS service takes care of the little things. They know your name, they anticipate your needs, look for ways to solve problems (example: 20 people waiting half hour for a cab on a weekday morning will just kick start a bad day - thought they would just pull some town cars to help. Here was a perfect opportunity to make it better but instead people just stood in a partly shielded taxi area with wind and rain blowing without the heatlamps on). If I could score half stars, I would have given my experience a 3.5 rating, It's good, better than average but not very good. If I was traveling with family, I might consider another location - I don't recall seeing that they have a Kids for All Seasons pgm here.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay with excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: take-your-time
Reviews.Content: The Elysian was fully booked so we decided to try the Ritz and it was a great hotel in typical Four Seasons character. The rooms are not flashy but ours offered a great view of Lake Michigan and was quite large by comparison to other US hotel rooms (deluxe room category). However the bathrooms were old and a disappointment: the toilet and bath/shower were contained together in a little room off the much larger space which held two basins. You needed some level of acrobatics to get in and out of the bath and the immediate proximity to the toilet was bizarre. The space is clearly there but these bathrooms need to be gutted and redesigned for this to be a truly 5-star hotel. As for the staff and public areas of the hotels - no complaints at all. Staff are very helpful and friendly and the lobby is lovely. The breakfasts were a standout - exceptional quality and exceptional service. I would stay again in this hotel just for those (and I don't usually eat breakfast!). Good location too. A final tip - after I had booked direct with the hotel I came across a site 'WhataHotel' which offered amazing complimentary perks with their bookings. It turned out that it was exactly the same price I was paying direct with the hotel but it included breakfast each day (a must!), an upgrade if available (it wasn't but the hotel was busy) and an $85 credit for a lunch as well! I emailed Greg of WhataHotel (run by Lorraine Travel in Florida) and he organised for the booking to be assigned to them so that we received the complimentary perks. Brilliant! We also booked another hotel through them and received about $300 off the best advertised rate at the hotel. Definitely worth checking out!

Reviews.Title: “The Pretender”
Reviews.Author: Gutreaction
Reviews.Content: Jackson Browne write a hit song about three decades ago called The Pretender about a man who lives a life that is not his. The same is true of the Ritz Carlton Chicago. Letâ€™s start with the revelation that the Ritz Carlton is not really a Ritz Carlton. It is a Four Seasonâ€™s property with the name, logo and towels of the Ritz Carlton but without the benefits of the new Ritz customer loyalty program or the Ritz culture of customer service. For this reason, I am not going to refer to the hotel as The Ritz Carlton, but will call it â€œThe Pretender.â€� The rooms are comfortable but tired. They were nice in 1982. The hotel has the â€œChicagoâ€� lobby. Like many hotels in the Windy City, you must take an elevator from street level to a higher floor where they locate the lobby. The Pretender is connected to a vertical shopping mall, but most of the shops located there are on the lower end and the crowd has baggy jeans and wear their baseball caps backwards and to the side. The fitness center, which is nothing special, is located in a separate elevator bank from the rooms and from the elevators that get you to the streetâ€”thatâ€™s right, there are three different elevator banks which can be hell if you leave for a drink and you are going to want to leave for a drink. The food in the lobby restaurant is good and the service is excellent. Breakfast is wonderful. The Pretender has a small bar in the lobby and no other bar on the property. If you enjoy a hotel bar, you do not want to stay hereâ€”try The Peninsula instead. The bellmen are outstanding and very helpful in every conceivable way. The crew is absolutely first rate. The front desk folks try hard to be helpful, but they seem to have very little discretion to accomplish much for you without asking someone else somewhere else for permission. At a real Ritz, when you ask the folks at the front desk for something, they most always answer, â€œwe will take care of itâ€� and then they go and try to figure out how they are going to do that. At The Pretender, they share their stream of consciousness thoughts with you about how difficult it will be to accomplish your request and then they never give you much confidence that it is really going to happen. If you are from a small town in the Midwest and you are making a trip to the big city, you might be impressed by The Pretender. If you are an experienced traveler you will wonder why your agent booked you at The Pretender and feel cheated that you were not booked at The Peninsula.

Reviews.Title: “it is always magical”
Reviews.Author: joewampler48
Reviews.Content: every tme we go to Chicago we always go to the Ritz---i love the swimming pool and use it every day.we love to come back and have a drink with Romel and Stacy after a day of walking shopping and visiting our kids in Lincoln Park. We were only supposed to stay 3 days and ended up 6 days.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for anniversary trip!”
Reviews.Author: LDianneRichardson_TX
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed the view of the lake and the comfortable room. No chocolates with turn-down service, but otherwise the housekeeping staff does a great job. All personnel are extremely friendly and willing to go above and beyond. Appreciated the storage of our luggage on checkout before needing to leave for the airport.

Reviews.Title: “What else can you say..”
Reviews.Author: Wtrmlngurl
Reviews.Content: Obviously a place like the Ritz has amazing service and properties, that goes without saying. My stay at the Ritz Chicago was wonderful, beautiful rooms with all the touches i appreciate (nice tub, robes, quality bath products, spacious bathroom). We stayed on the 24th floor and it was nice to see the sunrise over Lake Mich and the Navy Pier. All staff was extremely friendly and attentive. Sometimes too attentive (we had lots of knocks on our door for this or that even when we had our do not disturb sign up). My only prior luxury stay was at Waldorf in NYC and I must say that from room size to amenities to service, the Ritz Chicago has it beat. The location is great for walking around the city, about a 20-25 minute walk from millenium park and plenty of shops, restaurants closer.

Reviews.Title: “Hitting the heights”
Reviews.Author: Clontarf6
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a few days in October. Great friendliness at checkin, upgrades discussed and we took one. The front desk was also very helpful in keeping our bags after checkout and before departure for the airport. Lots of space in the junior suite, two bathrooms, sitting area and air conditioning that stayed off when we switched it off (a definite plus for us). Bed was very comfortable, wifi was fine (but that was with the version one pays for), great to get two newspapers in the morning. An area for improvement was the restaurant - the hotel is going for a more informal style, no problem with that, but the food tended to take a long time to emerge even when the place was not busy. The range was ok, the quality was ok too, but not 5 star. Another aspect we thought couldbe better was information about what to do. We headed over to the information office across the road, and perhaps its proximity is the reason for little if any readily available information (e.g. maps) in the lobby area. That said, we enjoyed our stay and would use the hotel again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great great hotel - wonderful service and stay!”
Reviews.Author: roos1ter
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our 10 yr anniversary, after being engaged in Chicago in 2000. From the get go, our stay was made extremely special, with a wonderfully warm from welcome from the front desk agent, Letitia Ryan who subsequently sent free drinks to our room - a lovely, unexpected, gesture. Our room was spacious with an amazing view to Water Tower Place, and the bed and linen extremely comfortable. The hotel staff were extremely gracious and unobtrusive, making our stay extremely special. Thank you so much for making our anniversary so perfect - we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: babspottay
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience at the Ritz Carlton. I was hosting a group of professors and journalists for a television panel and looked at several hotels before choosing the RC. I had a feeling that the service would be the most personal there and I was not disappointed. The staff was attentive and friendly, just the right amount of attention without being too much. The rooms are spotless and comfortable, the views of Chicago and the lake are beautiful, the lobby and restaurant feel modern and welcoming and the work out room and pool are lovely. The beds are super comfortable and the air conditioning is quiet and consistent. No fans going on and off all night! There is complimentary WiFi but a high speed connection is $10 per day. During our stay, we had a few people forget things in their rooms or in the lobby and the problems were solved easily and graciously with one phone call to hotel security. We ate several meals in the restaurant and there was a good selection of smaller plates and entrees to make everyone happy. The mixed drinks were expensive but the dinner prices were reasonable. The hotel is above a mall where there are lots of choices for quick food so that was a good option for those who wanted to grab something and go. The location of the hotel is central to Michigan Avenue and the lake which was nice for out of towners who wanted to walk and see a few sights. I would highly recommend the hotel for business or pleasure and will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location, great service and knowledgeable concierge”
Reviews.Author: Fraser C
Reviews.Content: I took my wife for her 30th birthday to Chicago - the Ritz was right in the middle of the Magnificent Mile, in the broadway theatre. This location was perfect for walking to most places. Everything was perfect from the staff to the concierge to the cleanliness of the room. Would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Janet1967_12
Reviews.Content: the hotel and staff were lovely. I truly had a great stay. I also loved the view and the shopping mall.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel in Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: 1boutiquebabe
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for 3 nights at The Ritz in Chicago. The location is excellent right on the magnificent mile and on top of the Water Tower Mall. The service and quality of the hotel is what you would expect from a Four Seasons Hotel. The rooms were clean and the beds very comfortable. We had asked for a coffee maker in our room as it was not a standard feature in the rooms. They sent one up immediately however we did have to call down daily as they never replenished the coffee or gave us clean cups when they removed the old cups. Aside from that small inconvenience everything else was very good and we would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great city. Location was perfect and the front desk staff was so welcoming and extremely friendly.”
Reviews.Author: tgnyc4
Reviews.Content: my tag line says it all, stay here when visiting Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, but not excellent.”
Reviews.Author: mosquito7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 3 nights mid-Sep with my family. The location couldn't be beat, right in the center of Gold Coast, lots of good shops and restaurants within walking distance. The standard double room was comfortable and the bathroom was quite big. Housekeeping was very generous with the L'Occitane toiletries. Had breakfast in the lobby restaurant every day. The servers were very slow to clear the tables so that there was always a 5-10 minute wait even though there were plenty of unoccupied tables! Once you got a table, the food was served fast, tasty and the servers were nice. We asked the concierge for a Japanese restaurant recommendation and we were directed to Taiyo which was terrible! We were very disappointed and surprised that a 5-star hotel would recommend such an awful place. The food was not authentic and they didn't even use proper sushi rice!

Reviews.Title: “Nothign but the best”
Reviews.Author: ErikontheGO
Reviews.Content: This last trip to the windy city, I had a chance to return to the Ritz Carlton. I hadn't stayed there in a few years but was greeted by name and felt like I had been there just the week before. The service was exceptional and the accomodations top notch. I arrived on the early side, yet was offered an early check-in as well as complete use of the Hotels great fascilities. The location is great and I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Stellar service”
Reviews.Author: AvonTravler
Reviews.Content: Let's dig into the details: Service - Bellman - F. We arrived and there was no offer to help with the luggage (trunk of the taxi was full). It wasn't that busy and they definitely were standing around. Front desk - A+. Stellar service. This is more like it / what I expected from the Four Seasons (yes, a bit confusing - a Ritz hotel run by the Four Seasons). Maid Service - A++. Room was always promptly made up and turn down-service was discrete. Room - The rooms are very nice and quiet. However, there are more modern hotels in Chicago (such as the Peninsula). Obviously the building is old and they have done the best with the space that they could without investing massive sums of money to upgrade the rooms. We had a corner suite, which was very large and had a great view of the lake. Other - If you have small children, this is the place to stay. Our daughter was able to pick out a small toy from a wagon they wheeled out upon check-in, they had a play tent already set up in the room, and child bath products. This is Four Seasons service at its best.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ScreamingMiMi98
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to Chicago to go shopping on Michigan Avenue and to go to a Cubs game. My mother and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton and got a deluxe room with two beds. I found it hard to find a hotel room with two beds. They seem to go fast in Chicago. I am so glad we sprung for the Ritz Carlton. This hotel offers access to everything and the Concierge was the nicest, most helpful person. The directions to take CTA to and from the Cubs game were perfect. We loved our stay. We could not tell there was anyone else staying at the hotel because it was very quiet. As with every other Ritz Carlton I have experienced, the room service is incredible. We ordered dinner twice and breakfast every morning and their food is great. We will definitely stay here again. The hotel is right next to the John Hancock tower so you have to go to the observatory which is open 9AM to 11PM everyday.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location and wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: lightangel
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is always top notch in service and this one does not dissapoint. The location is terrific with the Water Tower and Michigan Avenue. The rooms are updated and beautiful and the view of the lake is magnificant.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca S
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, lovely hotel, with very attentive staff. Made my daughter and I feel very welcome on our first trip to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “We were made to feel special.”
Reviews.Author: vfd1
Reviews.Content: We were recently in Chicago for our anniversary. The experience was wonderful. From the bellman to manager, we were always met with a warm greeting. The concierge took care of getting the flowers for me, along with some personal touches of her own. The restaurant staff greeted us with a Happy anniversary card signed by the staff, and the hotel even tossed in a nice bottle of wine. The location is terrific, the staff is unbelievable. Everyone goes out of their way to make you feel like " ...it is all about you..."

Reviews.Title: “A must for anyone serious about visiting the best hotels in the world! A delight from beginning to end.”
Reviews.Author: gsestrin
Reviews.Content: A wonderful property with some of the best service anywhere. A joy throughout, with beautifully appointed rooms and a gorgeous lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Experience”
Reviews.Author: max88s
Reviews.Content: I treated myself to a suite at this magnificent hotel, after completing a very strenuous trip. I was exhausted when I arrived, but from the moment I was greeted by the extremely cordial staff until the moment my bags were placed carefully into my car upon departure, my time was perfection. I was in one of the best suites in the property, on the 29th Floor. Since it was a corner suite, I had magnificent views of both the lake and Michigan Avenue. I hardly left my suite since it was so incredible I couldn't stand not to soak up every moment. Room service, though expensive, is worth every penny. The staff is uncommonly friendly and attentive to every detail. The concierge helped me to print and assemble some documents which I emailed to her. They were ready and perfect within minutes. There's not enough space here to talk about the amazing time I had in this world-class hotel. I'll be back, and next time my wife will be with me!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in the heart of a great city”
Reviews.Author: MTrentos
Reviews.Content: Chicago is an amazing city filled with wonderful hotels and dining spots. For those that want a great view of the city, stay at the Ritz Carlton, just a few steps away from the "magnificant mile", a requrest a lake view. We were on the 29th floor and the view took your breath away. The lobby bar and dining room were fantastic, the staff both at the reception and the concierge desks, were fantastic. Warm, friendly, helpful and really made you feel special.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Experience”
Reviews.Author: KathyBlount
Reviews.Content: Experiencing the Ritz-Carlton Hotel Chicago, A Four Seasons Hotel was the most refreshing personalized service experience I have had in many years. As a Meeting and Event Planner, this is especially important. From the greeting at the entrance to the check-in and delivery of my luggage to my room the staff was most expedient, pleasant, sincere and personable as they could be. The employees in all areas called me by my last name from the moment I arrived to the moment I departed. I was actually planning an event for a client in the beautiful Pearson Room on the 12th floor with a grand panoramic view of the lake and downtown. As I am sometimes the client and other times a vendor, this trip I was a vendor setting up an elegant dinner for a corporate client. The banquet staff was so gracious and more than helpful. They treated me like royalty, always addressing me as Miss Kathy. They could not do enough to assist me with the set-up of my event. I asked for a trash bag to clean up my own debris and the banquet staff would not allow it. They insisted on doing it themselves. At least 2 of the banquet captains, Francis and Ben were always making sure I had something to drink during the set-up, serving the Diet Cokes on silver platters! I found room service, concierge, bell staff and restaurant staff all exhibiting their services above and beyond perfection. Big Winner!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: DrGary105
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights in a deluxe executive suite recently with my wife and younger daughter for a wedding. The girls loved the spa and the accommodations were wonderful in all respects.

Reviews.Title: “Very lovely hotel but we would never pay the price to stay there, had a great rate due to a wedding.”
Reviews.Author: safari1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night to attend a wedding at the Ritz-excellent views of the city. The rooms are spacious and clean. Didn't eat there as felt $50 for breakfast was more opulent than we needed to be.... Worth adding to your bucket list! Very convenient to all activities in the heart of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: markhamite
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 3 nights at this hotel. Wow!! What a great place. The hotel is beautiful, the rooms clean and the views were fabulous. The valet parking was a great convienience. We had breakfast in the hotel restaurant twice and although it was expensive, it was great. The lobby bar was a wonderful place to wind down before heading up to our room. It was so quiet up in the room, it was like there was no one else on our floor. The staff were always pleasant and ready to make our hotel experience perfect. This is a 5 star hotel at it's best!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: abeja1
Reviews.Content: Have stayed in many Ritz Carleton over the world- and this one just wasn't up to par. There was the not the vigilant doorman to greet and open the door for you. The restaurant in the lobby was very disappointing. I ordered the scallop entree and received 3 scallops buried under a mound of extremely salty "greens", in a small baking dish. No imagination in the presentation or preparation. The room was superficially clean - a closer look revealed something dried splashed on the side of the desk. The decor was blander- no real flowers adorning each floor hallway- special touches which made the Ritz a special place to stay in the past The location was very good- convenient to all.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a special occasion celebration”
Reviews.Author: Laura R
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent in all regards, the greeting at arrival, the quality of the rooms, and the overall comfort and service. My husband and I stayed in a corner suite with lake view in the 20th floor to celebrate my birthday. The location of the hotel is perfect to stroll along the Magnificent Mile, visit restaurants, and having a nice downtown Chicago vacation. I cannot think of anything negative to say about the hotel or our stay. The bed was very comfortable and we enjoyed watching movies in our room. The restaurant was quite good too.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Plantriptoday
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent. Here is why: - Great location - can walk to many things - Excellent service - Quiet rooms - the rooms are laid out so it is very difficult to hear noise from the hallways. I have stayed here twice and have also not hear noise from neighbors. - Great gym - very full for a hotel gym - Windows that open - such a treat after a day of travel - Great breakfast - not cheap but tasty! - Many rooms have lake views I've stayed at this hotel twice and it's a great place to stay when visiting Chicago. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “You cannot get better or friendlier service”
Reviews.Author: TheCains
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here many times this year for work. The stand out item is how every single employee there provides just outstanding service. Efficient, friendly, attentive - I don't know who hires and trains these people, but he or she or they are customer service wizards. The rooms are always immaculate and well appointed. The Ritz is of course, an old line hotel, so none of the sleek modern ways of many other hotels. And even though that style is not really our first choice, the Ritz wears it well. Timeless and classic.

Reviews.Title: “The best location in downtown Chicago! The Staff and the guest room were both exceptional. Great first time experience!”
Reviews.Author: Leslie P
Reviews.Content: The entire Staff, from our immediate arrival to our departure, were highly professional, courteous, and knowlegable. The guest room we stayed in gave us a view of the lake and the city. The room was cleaned twice a day: in the morning and late evening upon our return from sight-seeing. The location was perfect. It was in the center of everything and within walking distance to some of the main attractions.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay with first rate service.”
Reviews.Author: shane_merritt
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some of the best hotels in the world and the Ritz-Carlton Chicago is certainly on par with all of them and exceeding in many areas. The spa is certainly worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Chicago is the epitome of elegance and customer service. The staff is amazing.”
Reviews.Author: klam7812
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Chicago is the epitome of elegance and customer service. The staff is amazing and service incdible. A superb hotel for any occasion, close to shopping and Michigan Avenue.

Reviews.Title: “A five star hotel that lives up to it's rank.”
Reviews.Author: Sunburned31
Reviews.Content: Five start hotels in major cities are frankly, expensive. You pay for service. The hotel immediately upgraded my wife and I to a larger room. The service was friedly and helpful. The concierge recommeded a local italian resturant (that didnt take reservations) yet called and got us a table. The hotel is in a great location. A block off Michigan Ave (Magnificient Mile) and right in the middle of the shopping district. Very nice spa and fitness room. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: Thinggoo73
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful!! When we checked in, Sean Murphy asked us about our occasion. We told him that it was our anniversary. Later that day, we received free chocolate covered strawberries and drinks as our anniversary gift and handwritten card from Sean. Everyone was friendly. Location of the hotel is great too. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This was a little piece of heaven.”
Reviews.Author: havabaci
Reviews.Content: The service and rooms were impeccable. I brought my dogs, the staff welcomed them and helped to make it enjoyable for all of us.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Business Travel”
Reviews.Author: Pookie2467
Reviews.Content: Stayed for business. The hotel was great. The front desk staff was quick and attentive as one would expect from a Ritz Carlton Hotel. I was on the 21st floor and the room was very quiet with a nice view. In-room internet only cost $9.95 which is a bargain these days. When traveling to Chicago on business, I will definitely stay at the Ritz again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: epps97
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ritz Carlton the past two years and wouldn't stay anywhere else in Chicago. You're within walking distance of so much and cabs are so easy to catch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, room service at 3 am”
Reviews.Author: Marru13
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many Chicago hotels and really enjoyed the Ritz Carlton.
