It is attached to the shopping mall water tower and a half block from Michigan Ave. We could see Navy pier from the window. The service was excellent from the doorman to the room service at 3 am. It's kind of wierd that the lobby is on the 12th floor. The gym is on the 11th and seems like the basement but is very well equipped. They even had a flat iron for me. I felt totally pampered! As usual, like all good Ritz's, you can check out at 12 and then spend the day at the spa or gym and then shower and get ready for your flight. No problem!

Reviews.Title: “Great room great food!”
Reviews.Author: wegoaroundtheworld
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel - the service and the rooms were on par with the Four Seasons a couple of blocks away (still don't quite understand why this Ritz-Carlton is specifically associated with the Four Seasons while the other ones are not). Room was spacious and clean. Ordered room service for breakfast and it was great - arrived right on time and the food was warm. Note that gratuity is already included but you can't tell when the service person is standing there looking at you for another tip! Gym was small (and very crowded).

Reviews.Title: “Great room, quiet!! Always wonderful service.”
Reviews.Author: MMG1
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay, well located on Michigan Ave with every amenity you could want.

Reviews.Title: “As always excellent service and facilities. Our favorite place to stay in Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: runerandrider
Reviews.Content: We enjoy relaxing with a drink in the lobby bar and taking in the view of the lake..

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel; Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_and_Steve
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this hotel for our anniversary, and it was a truly wonderful experience. We loved the location, right in Water Tower Place, and especially enjoyed the serenity that accompanies having a lobby 12 floors above street level! Everything about this hotel was elegant, from the reception, to the lobby and public spaces, to the guest rooms. The concierge was also spot-on with the one restaurant recommendation she made. We love Chicago, and our stay at the Ritz made it that much better. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best Ritz's I have stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: Rocket5
Reviews.Content: I came to the ritz with myself and one of my bridesmaids to stay after a full day of wedding dress shopping! This hotel was perfect location to EVERYTHING in chicago downtown. The staff was So friendly I felt giddy every time one of them spoke to me they were all so kind! The lounge is incredible with gorgeous views of Chicago and the rooms are Superb! Beds are comfortable, bathrooms are very modern and spacious! I will stay here anytime I go back to Chicago! Thanks Ritz you made my day very special!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: idasp
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton in Chicago is everything one expects from a good hotel, great service, great location, clean, and good food. I would go there any time. Staying there enhanced our trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view, great amenities, super comfy bed, and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: Toddington
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for downtown Chicago visit. Close to shopping, restaurants, lake, and Navy Pier. Great views, upscale ambience, wonerful service, and great staff. Water tower place shopping just feet away.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service.....as always!!”
Reviews.Author: MurphyandZoe
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton is my "go to" hotel while in Chicago - the service is always impeccable.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdowning8847
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very nice and room quality was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: puffinsrock
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights eith our two kids, ages 8 and 4. We had a two-bedroom suite. The kids got to "camp" in the living room in a hotel-set-up tent. It was quiet and lovely. We had an amazing view of the lake and Navy Pier. Great location. Loved!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Cremagrande
Reviews.Content: Every detail was taken care of at this beautiful hotel; our bags were placed in our room after we arrived early, a table was moved in the bar to accommodate our larger group...even a courtesy call to see if we wanted a paper delivered to the room each morning. We definately will be going back to the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Style, comfort, and peace - we loved every minute at the Ritz-Carlton Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property in 1994 for our 10th anniversary and couldn't wait to come back for my wife's 50th birthday party on 8/6/11 with four other couples. We booked five rooms, one of which was a Lakeside suite which had the space for all 10 of us to get together and celebrate. The other four rooms were Deluxe Kings and fantastic too. The hotel staff was excellent from the moment we pulled up to the ground floor on Pearson Street just off Michigan Ave. (part of Water Tower Place and next door to the John Hancock Center...perfect location!) to our checkout experience. The bell staff came to our car immediately and took our bags and the valet parked the car, all within about 2 minutes...very efficient. Check in was easy and fast and all was in order despite their being 100% booked due to Lollapalooza Festival going on in Grant Park. The lobby on the 12th floor is gorgeous with many comfortable chairs/couches and a great bar with a view as well as their new Decca restaurant. When we arrived in the room, the hotel staff had sent a chocolate birthday cake (best we've ever had!!) and a bottle of Louis Roderer champagne ahead of time...nice touch. The rooms are appointed nicely and the beds are VERY comfortable, plus the sound insulation is excellent and kept all outside/street noises muffled so well we had no problems sleeping. We also visited the spa and had massages which were wonderful (you can only get a massage at this property if you are a guest (or a member). We had brunch on Sunday and then checked out...only one night, but very special, and very memorable. We would stay at the Ritz-Carlton again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: khanks70471
Reviews.Content: Great location, top notch personal service from check-in to check-out. They go above and beyond to make your stay very special

Reviews.Title: “We had a great three night stay - wonderful assistance from the Concierge desk with orgainizing tours and restaurants.”
Reviews.Author: pta2626
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is beautiful. Our room was quite large and the bed was great. We had a wonderful lunch in the lobby cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!”
Reviews.Author: conniemappleton-wi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last week and loved every moment. The customer service is outstanding from the moment you check in until the moment your car leaves the valet area. The location is fantastic, close to restaurants and nightlife, we walked to Navy Pier. Loved the park across the street. Will definitely be back again and again as our son will be attending college in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “What just happened here?”
Reviews.Author: TeamHayes
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Ritz Carlton for an extended anniversary weekend left us confused. A few weird occurrences: being told if we waited 1 1/2 hours we would receive an upgrade, only to be placed in an antiquated apartment with old, graying carpeting and sterile, minimal furnishing; a lost room-service breakfast that was found 90 minutes after ordered, only to be delivered as-was...the oatmeal was cold and had a hardened crust on top (not even a Waffle House would serve oatmeal in this state); the arrival of a beautiful evening snack which we had to (strongly) convince the room-service waiter was not ours...it had our room number on it, but a different name; calls to our room telling us that maid service was waiting for us to remove our "do not disturb" sign in order to clean our room...no such sign was up and we had in fact been out all day both days this occurred. Now, I must say that each time a mistake was made, management went out of their way to compensate us in some form or another. We were eventually placed in a beautiful corner suite and we received many, many, many orders of champagne and strawberries. They even offered to comp our cold breakfast, but our breakfasts were already included in our package. After awhile, the complimentary items lost their appeal. What we really wanted was a wonderfully romantic weekend, indulged in luxury that we usually deny ourselves. Unfortunately, the hotel's missteps caused us to fall slightly short of these expectations. I really hope our experience was the exception rather than the rule at the Ritz in Chicago. I do want to say, though, that this hotel has the most complete workout facility I have ever seen in a hotel gym. Free weights, rollers, hand weights, weighted bars...we were able to get a couple of great workouts with everything we could want in easy reach.

Reviews.Title: “service service service !! what wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: mavis-too
Reviews.Content: love staying here ...this place is the bomb! no matter which side north or south the views are simply amazing. this trip we took advantage of the spa. both of us had massages with kind and knowledgeable therapists: zoey and livius. thank you for taking such good care of us. we also used the gym, pool and shower rooms. our thanks to the wonderful staff. this area is super taken care of by very considerate people. everything is maintained, extremely clean and the amenities are fab: fresh fruit, lemon water, lavender towels, herbal tea, etc. etc. if you are coming to chicago, there is no better place to call home. thank you to all the staff at the ritz every time.

Reviews.Title: “It was first class”
Reviews.Author: Jeffz45
Reviews.Content: Was a great hotel service was great. Would return to hotel

Reviews.Title: “What a gorgeous hotel”
Reviews.Author: lilybeach
Reviews.Content: Our room was spacious, impeccably clean, with a huge bathroom. The bed was excellent. the staff makes you feel like a special person, no matter who you are. This hotel made our trip! And the concierge recommended the perfect restaurant. It was walking distance, chef-owned, delicious, and charming. If you can afford it, the Ritz-Carlton is the place to stay in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “great location. They upgraded me to a suite for $200 a night. Great staff. Heading back in May.”
Reviews.Author: abercrombie1
Reviews.Content: see if they are offering up grades at check in. Great location heading back in May for girls trip and the ladies are world travelers .

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: vanGoghsCat
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love this place......transferred to the Ritz from another hotel nightmare. Perfection! Husband and son were thrilled.....we had a suite with a kitchen; basically a mini apartment on the 15th floor/Room 1523. Internet service worked fabulous and my husband could still "work" during our vacation. So he was happy; us not so much with the working. You get what you pay for and this was pure heaven. I don't think we could ever stay anywhere else again! This hotel was the cherry on our sundae. And Oprah is in the penthouse......we did not see her.....it was so hot in Chicago, I'm sure she was hanging in Hawaii while we burned up in Chi town. The Ritz is like no other......you won't be disappointed. Trust me, my husband and son are divas and hard to please!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, but...”
Reviews.Author: bdmiller45
Reviews.Content: Superb location right on top of all the shops and near Oak Street beach. Friendly staff and the service you'd expect. We were very pleased with the property, but two things... Security around west entrance breezeway (adjacent to mall) left a little to be desired. And a power outage the last night had us up regularly. The front desk was not especially sympathetic about this major annoyance, providing a sour end to our otherwise excellent trip.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Chi-Town......”
Reviews.Author: BigWhale
Reviews.Content: I always stay at the Ritz Carlton Chicago when in Chi-Town.....great service, great food....amazing views. I usually stay here during the cardiology meetings that always grace Chicago at the McCormick Place.....and I'm usually here for ay least 5 days....I just love it here!

Reviews.Title: “Great people, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Becky8319
Reviews.Content: Just back from my first visit to Chicago. The view from our room on the 27th floor of the lake was amazing. The Ritz Carlton has a great open feel, with a beautiful bar for a pre-dinner cocktail. The staff is great. Very helpful with recommendations and maps, etc. One of the best things about the hotel is the location. Perfectly located for site-seeing. An easy walk to the fun of Rush Street, or the lake, close to the Chicago Metro Station for getting around to the other sites, such as Millennium Park, Chinatown, the Planetarium, etc. Great shopping on Michigan Avenue right out the front door. Museum of Contemporary Art right night door. Loved it, and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Always a great choice”
Reviews.Author: Samejesse
Reviews.Content: I have been coming here for over 9 years and have never been dissapointed or had any problems. All of the staff are fantastic from the bar to the restaurant to the gift shop attendant.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel with great rooms, service and food in a terrific location.”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer1992
Reviews.Content: I have previously stayed at the sister property, the Four Seasons Chicago, as well as the Elysian. All are fabulous hotels, but the Ritz-Carlton Chicago has a more relaxed feel while still very luxurious. The food is excellent, and the location above Water Tower Place terrific. Some rooms have views of the fireworks at Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Would Definitely Return”
Reviews.Author: Erictravel
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed 4 nights at the RC Chicago for our Anniversary. From the moment we walked into the lobby, we absolutely loved it. We were then surprised to learn they upraded us to a beautiful suite. What an amazing surprise! The room was spectacular, with views of the lake and city. The room was extremely spacious, clean, and so quiet. Housekeeping did a great job, and provided nightly turndown service. The hotel location was perfect. It is on a beautiful stretch of the Magnificent Mile. It was not far from restaurants, or the Chicago "L" stop. We loved foodlife in the lower level in the mall downstairs. We went their a bunch of times and loved it (and was SO convenient). In addition, the Chicago tourist bureau has an office right across the street from the hotel....And, if you do a Hop on Hop Off tour, there are two stops on either side of the hotel. The service at the hotel were just fantastic....including the front desk (so nice and helpful), concierge (helpful and so knowledgeable), housekeeping (great job and so nice), etc. Just to illustrate how great the service was, my wife and I wanted to ship some items home, and called housekeeping to see if they had any boxes. They told me, they will see if they can locate any for us. Within minutes, there was a knock on our door.....they brought us a few boxes. They were exactly what we needed. We couldn't believe how responsive they were, and that they took the time to find boxes for us. The common areas of the hotel were really beautiful, especially the lobby. It was such a great place to come back to at the end of the day. I would definitely return to the Ritz Carlton Chicago. It exceded all of our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Best of Both Worlds”
Reviews.Author: TexasTX_Travelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed with Amex FHR and was upgraded to an Executive sweet, which had a great view of the lake on one side and Michigan Avenue on the other. They did forget our turndown service on the first night, but left a handwritten apology note and some chocolates the next day. The room was very well maintained, but the bathroom was somewhat disappointing (shower/tub combination and large vanity but only one sink). Overall, this was a wonderful property. The room was nice and big, the view was fantastic and the location is as good as it gets. We did eat in the hotel restaurant, which is in the main lobby area of the hotel. It does not look spectacular from the outside, but the food and the staff were incredible. We had an amazing meal and Sun-Thurs during the Summer they have half price wine (every bottle on their extensive list). I highly recommend this property if staying in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great deal (stay for 3 nights, pay for 2 nights). Highly recommend, can't go wrong with Ritz.”
Reviews.Author: mgwolp
Reviews.Content: Use American Express Platinum for additional freebies - breakfast and a dinner.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: msjdrink
Reviews.Content: Our experience at the Ritz-Carlton was absolutely Fabulous!! The service, room, and staff were all outstanding. We had a great time and plan to stay again the next time we visit Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great experience at the hotel as well as the city of Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: saxmanDaytonOhio
Reviews.Content: The shopping in the mall below the hotel was amazing. Eight floors of every type shopping imaginable.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest place we have ever stayed!”
Reviews.Author: MLSCleveland
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Chicago this week-end to celebrate our anniversary. We decided to stay at the Ritz Carlton Hotel. It was everything and more that they said it would be. Beautiful room, wonderful lobby, great view and spacious room. We felt totally pampered. The concierge was extremely helpful (Lauren). For our anniversary they sent up a bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries. So, so nice. Thank you Ritz we will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: PostVacationAdvice
Reviews.Content: First rate hotel which is what you hope for from a Ritz but it is helpful to know that it lives up to expectations. Favorite part was view of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier. Had our own private viewing of the fireworks show from our room. I recommend Lake View Room or Suite if you can get it. Staff was competent and courteous. Every detail was A+. Only drawback was that you had to transfer elevators to get to rooms. The elevators were very fast and there was no waiting which was nice, but they stopped so quickly it could make you a little sick to your stomach at times. Not sure there's a way to fix this but thought it might be useful information to include. In spite of this I would still highly recommend the Ritz Carlton in Chicgo!

Reviews.Title: “Better than home”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer175
Reviews.Content: I love staying here! The rooms are very comfortable and the room service is delicious. You can't go wrong staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence. You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: TravelNatL
Reviews.Content: Great hotel - it's a Ritz. About what you expect. Hubby and I and 13 month old in Chi for 4th of July holiday. Excellent service, room, amenities. GREAT gym, one of the best in a hotel I've ever seen (I've seen a lot). Elevators are small and slow, parking is outrageously expensive. But it's a GREAT location, excellent food, service... again, it's a Ritz. You get what you pay for. Look for internet deals to make it more affordable. That's what we did. Excellent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat!”
Reviews.Author: TampaReviewreader
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip and we stayed an additional day take in the city. From the moment you encounter an employee, you feel well cared for. The service was far beyond expectation. Our room was beautifully appointed and we had a lovely view of the lake. The gym was amazing with water bottles and chilled peppermint infused towels offered to cool down after your workout. The location right off the Magnificent Mile provided easy access to great shopping and restaurants. We are "walkers" and were happy to trek about, but the museums and other attractions may be a long walk for some and especially for young children.

Reviews.Title: “What a Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: azgowild
Reviews.Content: What service, what a view, what a room! I've never felt so pampered nor have I ever slept better in a hotel. Quiet and clean and comfortable. We'll never stay anywhere else again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Chicago Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: BloomfieldHills
Reviews.Content: Wonderful rooms and amenities, good location, well trained and helpful staff. Moises who is a server in the lounge was especially attentive to us. All in all, we had a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Calming, luxurious, with all lthe amenities and a perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: pgtraveler28
Reviews.Content: The view from our room was splendid, high above the city streets with sweeping views of the lake, Navy Pier's ferris wheel, and the great architecture of the surrounding buildings. The room was crisp, clean, and had every amenity needed and more. The bed was big, plush, and I never heard noise from any other guests above or aroudn us, which for a light sleeper like myself is much appreciated.Room service was speedy, food was always delicious, and carts/trays were promptly whisked away without even noticing. The bathroom was spacious with two sinks, a large tub with shower, and great water pressure. The hotel lobby sparkled with crystal chandeliers, high windows with bright light in the lounge, and cool air which is perfect on hot summer days. Everyone from check-in to bellhop to room service to the delightful spa staff were attentive but not overly in your face and everyone seemed pleased to be working there. The spa itself was a little gem with a great steam room, sauna, dressing rooms, and the hot stone massage I had was the most relaxing in my life, and I've had a lot of them! The Ritz in Chicago was truly wonderful and its location across from the Museum of Contemporary Art and the Magnificent Mile and two blocks from the shoreline was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to come back”
Reviews.Author: dtoney
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a fabulous location and the staff was nice and remembered all the things I had requested before check-in. I can't wait to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is wonderful! It has an amazing location and the staff, everyone, was very accomidating and wonderful to us.”
Reviews.Author: tune59
Reviews.Content: Very expensive, yet wonderful in every way. We loved the Water Tower Mall being an elevator ride away! This is a beautiful, beautiful hotel. They treat you very well, which I expected they would. I can't imagine staying at this hotel and not loving every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Ballet Getaway--one night in the Windy City”
Reviews.Author: pleasantpeninsula
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night in order to attend the Joffrey Ballet. While the hotel was fine for this purpose, we would probably not choose to stay there for a more lengthy vacation. The room was on the small side, did not have a table, and the only chair was a desk chair. The room seemed to be intended for a solo business traveler as opposed to a couple on vacation. The Ritz is located in Water Tower Place, so it is very convenient to shopping. We had booked a package which included dinner and breakfast. Dinner was just "okay", while breakfast was very good. Check-in and check-out were handled quickly and without problems. The staff we encountered were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Mauilover_9
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the hotel, they offered to upgrade us to a larger room for $50 more. We decided to treat ourselves and the room was lovely, however, there was more room than we really needed for the two of us. If we had our children with us, the second bathroom would have been a huge plus. The room was a little hot at night despite the thermostat. The fan in one of the bathrooms stayed on all time which was annoying. A personal peeve of mine is when hotels don't provide a coffee maker, and yes I know its the Ritz and they want you to order room service, however, I like grabbing a quick coffee when I want it. The bed was very comfortable and the room well appointed. Comes with flat screen tv's. The shower pressure was excellent although there were a couple of showers I had that were not as hot as I would have liked despite my efforts. Strangely someone knocked on our door every morning just after 7am. By the time I got there each time, there was no one there. Once I thought I saw a maid turning the corner. A little early for this considering we were on vacation. We rarely had to wait for an elevator, which is nice. The staff were uniformly excellent. We ate in the lounge once and had a great time. The calamari serving was a little too much and too heavy (the batter). The cheese tray, wine selection and beer were excellent. The location is perfect. You can walk to all the shopping you will ever need. Millennium Park, which I highly recommend. The gardens and sculptures are magnificent. Be sure to get you picture taken at the Cloud Gate and the Crown Fountain is really neat as well. The Art Institute of Chicago is attached to the park. We decided to visit the Institutes store and as we were leaving we noticed people lined up in the lobby. Lucky us, turns out there is fee admission to the Art Institute on Thursday evenings. If you appreciate art, its a must see. Looking for a great blues bar, you can't go wrong with Kingston Mines. A short cab ride to this brilliant club is well worth it. There is a $10 cover charge on Saturday nights but it is more than worth it. Made our trip and will become a must do every time we visit this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Consistent Ritz excellence.”
Reviews.Author: Pramstroker
Reviews.Content: Or is it Four Seasons? In either case, this hotel measured up when it comes to crisp, sharp, and luxurious accommodations. What one expects when one stays at a Ritz or Four Seasons. The only minor irritation is you have to take one elevator to the lobby and then another to your room. The room was top-notch and the view was excellent. The concierge was very helpful. There is excellent shopping close to the hotel. My wife and I enjoyed many of the sites of Chicago, all easily accessible by a short cab ride from the hotel. We even did the "touristy" double-decker site seeing bus that we got on just a few yards from the hotel. Not usually "our thing" but this was informative and interesting. Reviews for hotels like this one should be uneventful. I only have a lot to say when there are problems. Whether it's a Ritz or Four Seasons, both chains have figured out how to provide exceptional experiences on a consistent basis. This location is no different. I wouldn't call it a hallmark, memorable experience, but for the conference I attended, it was exactly what it needed to be: trouble free.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: itrvl4work
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week and I must say this hotel is both best in class for service and experience. I had a king suite, great view of the lake. The room was a mix of classic traditional and modern elegance. Complimentary shoe cleaning service was appreciated . I opted to have housekeeping every few days, each time housekeeping tied up all my chargers keeping the desk looking neat and tidy! Francisco (or Francesco?) at the front door was the best, always took care of all my requests. Beds are comfortable (better than Westin's!). Location is great, next to the Water Tower so shopping and food is very close. I never like eating breakfast in hotels, great options next door. Internet is free but if you want high speed to watch videos, movies, youtube etc. you should pay the $8.50 a day for a faster connection. Not a bad deal considering other hotels charge about $15 a day for questionable connection.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded My High Expections”
Reviews.Author: ravenstokes
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel with impeccable and personable staff. Attention to every detail and A+ customer service from every employee. Great food. Location is perfect for walking everywhere. Only flaw was that it made leaving too difficult!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, great for families”
Reviews.Author: Wayzfam
Reviews.Content: Steps from American girl store and water tower. Great location and kid friendly. The kids made cookies with pastry chef in kitchen and later had a visit from candyman! Rooms were very nice, restaurant was good. Value was good with third night free.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, efficient, elegant”
Reviews.Author: Mainetrippin
Reviews.Content: This was a quick business trip, but everything at the hotel worked as it should. Nice touch -- free wi-fi in my room. Generally, it's the Holiday Inns and the Marriott Courtyards that give free wi-fi and it's the high end hotels that gouge travelers at $20 a day for it. The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. The bed and pillows were nice and fluffy with high end linens allowing for a solid night's sleep. Wake up call came as ordered. Good sized bathroom with granite counter tops, two sinks, and ample tub. The staff were all efficient, polite, and helpful. I attended a conference at the hotel and the conference room staff were especially helpful. Great location, close to shops and attractions (not that I got to any of them!) with what would have been a great view, but for the two days of fog.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, fantastic hotel at an extremely reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: lc2cassina
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights at the Ritz on Business. Great location right on Michigan avenue with Starbucks across the street. Beautiful clean rooms with a window that opens to allow fresh air. The price was extremely reasonable and comparable to mid level hotels such as Marriott. Definitely will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “My Girls loved the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: GoNoles
Reviews.Content: Normally the Ritz is not the type of hotel I spend money on when traveling with my kids. But since the trip was over both my daughter's and husband's birthdays and we got a great discounted rate we went ahead and booked it. My girls absolutely loved this place. Of course, being on top of the American Girl Store certainly didn't hurt. When we arrived, one of the desk clerks came from behind the the counter with a wagon of toys for my girls to select one each. Great way to start. Then they had a cookie and gummy bears waiting in our room. The fact that there were little bath robes that were their size just thrilled them to death! They give each child a small bag of fish food to feed the gold fish in the indoor pond. They also do a little cookie decorating lesson where they are given chef hats to color then get to roll out and cookie cut dough. The baked cookies are later delivered to your room with icing for decorating. We never ate there so I don't know about the food. My only problem was that they put us in a room with only one king sized bed. They brought in a roll away cot and my little one (six years old) had to sleep on the couch. It all worked out fine and bc we had such a great rate ($199 which is good for the Ritz) I didn't want to question it and be a pain. But overall, it was worth it. The girls loved everything and since was my daughter's and husband's birthday gift we were pleased. The location is perfect and while we didn't have time to use it, there is a park across the street if your children get bored.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most perfect hotels anywhere”
Reviews.Author: cnalsc
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is great. The lobby is on the 13th floor, with the rooms above. Great lobby and restaurant/bar, great gym, beautifully appointed rooms that are mercifully quiet, impeccable service. Easy access to the shopping area connected to the building. I can't say enough about how great this hotel is. It's certainly the best in Chicago and it's one of the best hotels we've stayed in anywhere.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Northerner who lives in the south
Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous place to bring in the New Year!!”
Reviews.Author: Momof2andawife
Reviews.Content: We were the guests of my inlaws at this hotel for the New Year. We had a two bedroom suite and it was lovely. My in laws were above us in their own two bedroom suite with my sister in law. We ordered a lot of room service because the kids love to do that. My daughter loved the red wagon that greeted her. In addition, there were these cute, yummy snacks waiting in their room. The view of the fireworks was just amazing. I hope we get to spend the New Year here again! Wonderful treatment, excellent food and just lovely. We have stayed at other Ritz Carlton Hotels in Jamaica and Michigan and had equally delightful stays!

Reviews.Title: “Not quite perfect, but almost”
Reviews.Author: anita-msp
Reviews.Content: It's the Ritz, what more can I say? Great staff, clean rooms, nice view. I'll skip the usual that others have covered, but what mattered most to me as a business traveler was how easy it was to get from my room to the conference rooms. Elevators were quick and the lounge area was really conducive to post-meeting discussions. Food was readily available at all times and staff directed people where they needed to go. This is instead of big cardboard signs or plasma TVs that say, "Meeting 1: Waterfall Room" and you have no idea where the "Waterfall Room" is. If I were traveling on my own or with my family, I wouldn't be able to justify the cost of getting a real "Ritz" experience; parking is $35 a day. But with regard to conference logistics, it was the best experience I've had. I wasn't the only one who thought so -- the Miami Heat stayed at the Ritz, so if it's good enough for guys making $20 million a year, it's good enough for the rest of us.

Reviews.Title: “A Ridiculously Nice Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: rwalia99
Reviews.Content: I just want to get the only possible negative out of the way before I start gushing. I'm not a fan of the wallpaper. Ok, here we go... I've been to many hotels in my life, but have never experienced such a friendly and helpful staff like this. Everyone who works at this Ritz Carlton truly does everything they can to make sure you are happy and comfortable. If you're staying downtown, you really need to be staying here if you have the chance. We're not rich, but found a good rate on the hotel website. The lobby is incredible, the rooms are great, but again the people take this hotel to another level. Kate at the front desk was the single most helpful employee I've ever met at a hotel. We stayed here during a busy time (Oprah's final shows and Bulls-Heat in the NBA). There were a lot of celebrities at the hotel, including the Miami Heat team, but we were the ones who were treated like stars. Thank you Ritz Carlton, it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Brun0405
Reviews.Content: Great hotel that has the lobby on the 12th floor...lounge is an excellent place to have a drink/snack after a day of shopping/sightseeing. Rooms are large, clean & are well cared for by the staff. All of our needs were looke after with a smile and a "you're very welcome"...we will definitely return to this hotel when we visit Chicago. It is NOT the cheapest, but you get what you pay for. If you are looking for a great hotel with a perfect location - 80 yards from the "Mag Mile" and with a shopping centre built in, then look no furhter.

Reviews.Title: “Lush and lovely!”
Reviews.Author: indyoes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is upscale and very plush. If you're willing to spend a little more, you won't regret staying here. Great location, great views, comfortable rooms and wonderful staff. The room service is extremely pricey, but that is to be expected. They really take care of you though and make sure you have everything you need. It was an excellent overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “terrific as always”
Reviews.Author: WGLwellesleyma
Reviews.Content: We have had the pleasure of staying at many luxury hotels. This is simply the finest. I require accsessible accommodations and each time I am returned to the same great executive suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great attitude and service”
Reviews.Author: JBG_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here over Easter weekend and found it to be once again full of great service. It is to me a hotel that continually tries to please. Anja Gugger at the front desk up graded me to a beautiful huge suite with a view of the lake and city. Kevin Longstreth took care of a question I had after I left. He was prompt and extremely courteous. Room service for breakfast was always on time and everything was done just the way we like. When in Chicago I will return to this great hotel with its fine location and service.

Reviews.Title: “Once a favorite...”
Reviews.Author: profofphil
Reviews.Content: Along with The Pen, this was once one of our favorite Cicago hotels, but it's unlikely that we will return. We were awakened the first night by what seemed like a fan rattling. I called the front desk and was informed that it was a creaking sound created when the building--now "quite old"--swayed in the wind. I could switch rooms (at 2am), if I wanted to, but couldn't be assured of silence even then. The next day, after the room was cleaned, there was a little card on the stand by the bed--essentially telling me what I had dicovered the previous night. (Chicago, I believe, is a fairly windy city; no telling how long, or where in the hotel, swaying has produced the creaking sound.) At no point in our stay, did anyone offer even a simple apology. (We'd booked another room for another member of our family--their sleep was not interrupted.) We all had breakfast each morning, and drinks each evening. The lobby area was as pleasant as ever, but the service was sub-standard--in a variety of ways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: CorpusChristiJettie
Reviews.Content: During our room "tour" I noticed there was not a coffee pot and asked the bell man if there was a coffee shop down stairs. He gave me directions to a shop. That night when we returned from dinner, a silver tray with assorted coffees, cream, sugar, and a coffee pot were in our room. This is just an example of the great service the staff provides, from the housekeeping staff to the great waiters in the bar. The Ritz Carlton is a wonderful hotel and the staff understands great service. The location provides beautiful views of the downtown Chicago skyline. From rooms 2617 and 2618 (not adjoining) we could see the river and Navy Pier to the Sears Tower and the historic water tower. The American Girl Store is right downstairs and the John Hancock building is out the back door. For great shopping and dinning we did have to walk a few blocks or take a cab, but our cab rides never cost over $6.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful weekend”
Reviews.Author: tjh780
Reviews.Content: Geat experience from arrival to departure. Can not say anything remotely negative. Such a beautiful lobby. Even their 'bar food' is outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were impressed with the service during our recent stay. The rooms were very clean and the beds were SO comfortable! We ate at Deca and loved everything we had. Great quality!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L
Reviews.Content: The service from the minute we arrived until the minute we left was impeccable. The people at the front desk couldn't have been nicer. There were even greeters at the elevator. The room was filled with amenities: robes to wear, slippers, plenty of toiletries, magazines and even a book about the history of the Sharp family who started the Four Seasons Hotels. The view from our room was SPECTACULAR. I sat along the edge of the window taking in the beach, the lake the John Hancock Bldg and Michigan Ave. What a treat!! It goes beyond the Four Seasons high standards. Enjoy the perfect night or week-end at the Ritz!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: Sparty0323
Reviews.Content: The rooms are great, food even better and the service is perfect! Stayed in room 2707,lake view deluxe suite, and it was wonderful. Large room, quiet, and so very, very nice. Favorite hotel in the windy city...great escape! Room service is outstanding and the hotel restaurant is one of the best in the city....try the steak and eggs for breakfast!!! Can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay with kids!”
Reviews.Author: MOMMYEXEC
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend the Ritz Carlton Chicago to anyone traveling with or without kids. We took our two little ones (toddler and infant) and the hotel could not have been more accommodating. From the welcome toy wagon to the kid sized robes, toiletries and adorable bathroom and crib decoration, they made our kids feel welcomed and excited to be on vacation. My oldest also enjoyed swimming in the spa pool, baking cookies with the hotel chef and getting a visit from the hotel Candyman. My husband and I also had an incredibly comfortable and enjoyable stay as well, but it was the kid friendly amenities that really stood out. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Unrivaled luxury and service!”
Reviews.Author: Amykare
Reviews.Content: Our stay was fabulous! We were upgraded to an Executive Suite- very spacious room, 1.5 baths, luxury bath and walk in closet. The room was clean, comfortable and luxurious offering amazing views of Lake Mi and the city. The staff was friendly, prompt and very helpful. We wholeheartedly recommend you stay here- you won't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Do not understand some of the recent reviews”
Reviews.Author: WaupacaTraveller
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a brief stay at this hotel. It was a very good visit. I think the service is excellent, including the room amenities that previous reviewers recently stated were abscent. Not sure why people think it's a Ritz, the title of the hotel clearly states "a four seasons hotel." I usually stay in a suite, but this time stayed in a newly renovated superior room. Ir was very large for a big city, nicely decorated and had a great view of the lake and Oprah (just kidding, the Hancock bldg withall the celeb apts). Room service for breakfast was prompt and excellent. I had not visited this hotel in a while in that I usually stay across the street at the Four Seasons. Service and willingness of staff to assist were a good as any 4S I have visited. It was a pleasant suprise and definately on my radar for a repeat visit.

Reviews.Title: “Agree with last reviewer - not the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: WendyDesMoines_Iowa
Reviews.Content: We are at the hotel right now in suite 2410. This is our last night of 3. We chose this for the Ritz name AND for the convenience of being located so conveniently to the American Girl Store. We upgraded to a better suite than originally booked, so we can get a great review of the fireworkds on NY's Eve. The suite is VERY nice, but not quite as clean as the Ritz' we have stayed at previously. The last review was spot on regarding the bathroom, definitely not as nice as real Ritz. The service is definitey not up to Ritz' standards. The staff is not at courteous. We just ate dinner in the bar. For a $148 bill for appetizers for a family of four, the service was VERY slow. Apparently, all staff was being used for the NY's gala. The staff even cut off your path when walking, splitting up a family in a crowd. We are paying an average of 500/night (b/c 3rd night is at a reduced rate). If it wasn't for the view, I would be very annoyed for wasting our money. p.s. Even in one of the nicest suites in the hotel, they don't fill your ice or leave you bottled water (yet we saw it on the maids' cart

Reviews.Title: “There is a reason this hotel is not really a Ritz Carlton...”
Reviews.Author: indytraveler23
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at check in to learn this hotel is using the Ritz name but is not affiliated with the Ritz Carlton. Upon checking into my suite - the second nicest room level at this hotel - it was readily apparent why it is not part of the group. None of the typical Ritz amenities were available from the small things like their standard do not disturb signs all of the way to the turn down service with slippers and bed mats. The towels and the one robe were a generic well washed cotton with no logo. The bath room sink bases were made out of painted ply wood. In the master bedroom bath, the stool and shower were in the same room. This room was 6x6 feet at most. It was difficult to enter the shower without tripping over the toilet. The shower handle was out of another century and difficult to turn. Typically at a Ritz, the stool has a separate room and the shower is extremely nice along with a double vanity. The best I could say about our suite is that the carpet was an interesting pattern. At the time we stayed (12/26/10) we could have stayed at the Four Season for $40 more per night. This hotel is ok. It is not a Ritz Carlton and I can't believe the reviews on this site don't reflect this. The only thing I can think of is most of the travelers have never stayed at a Ritz before. But hey, they did have cotton balls and qtips so the stay was amazing right? And since the Four Seasons is managing it, aren't they smart to destroy the Ritz Carlton name in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and marvelous location”
Reviews.Author: JBG_10
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here with my grown daughter over the Thanksgiving. The staff was warm, welcoming, and helpful. The executive suite was fine for two women since instead of a luxury bath, one had two bathrooms which was great for two women getting ready to go out. The location was superb since it was connected with the Water Tower for convenient shopping without having to wear a coat. My only complaint was we were unable to get a reservation for tea. Since this is such a popular hotel for tea, perhaps informing the client upon reservations for a room that if you wanted to get tea on Black Friday,make that reservation with the room reservation. The other hotel on this level that I have stayed at in Chicago was the Peninsula. The Ritz Calton won easily with their staff. The Peninsula's staff was snooty and unhelpfu. The suite might have been larger at the Peninsula, but shabbier. The rate was higher at the Peninsula. The Ritz Carlton was offering three nights for the cost of two. Oh and the bed linens and the towels were the softest I have ever had and the beds were extremely comfortable. The housekeeper was most accomodating. All in all a most excellent stay. All in all a most pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: patrickwNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at The Ritz-Carlton Chicago twice now & both times had a very nice stay, but compared with other Four Seasons properties in the US, the service could be more polished, but is still good. The location is amazing, near El Stops, tons of shopping, a small park, the lake, etc.... I arrived on 3 December 2010 for 1 night. I arrived very early, around 9:30am, & my room wasn't quite ready. Within 25 minutes, someone called me & confirmed my room was ready for arrival, which was really nice! Mark, the doorman was very nice upon arrival, as was Christine at the Front Desk...she was incredibly polite, warm & welcome me back & quickly stored my bags. There was a long que at the desk, but 2 people came out & said someone would be with us shortly. Indeed they were. (I'm not sure who these people were saying this to us, but one appeared to be a trainee & other other guy disappeared to the back, but both were kind). My room #2411, had a great view, partially of the lake as well as the Water tower & Michigan ave. The beds are insanely comfortable...seriously the best hotel bed I've ever slept on:), the desk is roomy, & the tub in the bathroom is fairly deep. The tub & shower were together, & the water pressure was a bit slow to fill the tub, but nothing serious. As with all FS hotels, the bathroom was stocked with L'occtiane products, hairdryer, q-tips (which were incredibly soft, unlike some hotels with blunt ends that are incredibly uncomfortable to use!), robes, soft towels, etc. What I like most about this hotel are the rooms.....they are so quite & comfortable, even the carpeting is super soft, the TV reception is crystal clear, you don't hear doors slamming, turndown is provided without asking, etc... The Room Service Food is also amazing here!!!! I ordered both Dinner & Breakfast & the food each time was perfect. The Chicken Club Sandwich & Lemon Tart are both incredible! :) Additional requests are always granted, which is very nice. However, my breakfast order was really slow. To be fair, my order taker told me they were very busy & my order would take 55 minutes if not sooner. However it took about 1 hr & 25 minutes to arrive & my order was missing 2 requests. the items were brought back very quickly & my server was very apologetic...the food was hot & very good! Onto the service.....while Christine, Sean & Abby at the Front Desk are all very kind & warm, I feel the Concierges at this property are not very nice or welcoming......this has been my feeling on both stays. I never ask them many questions as I'm familiar with Chicago, but the times I have, they seem a little rude, & not enthusiastic or engaging at ALL!!! I saw them deal with other guests (at one point, a lady told a guest one moment someone will be with you soon & she went back to her computer screen to type....it was really rude & I have never seen this occur at a Four Seasons) & they all just seem the same.....it's really strange, b/c they all have Les Clefs'dor status for the most part, which is an honor among Concierges. I'M NOT GOING TO name the Concierges I saw being less than friendly, but maybe it's b/c it's a Union property & these guys have worked there forever & are just not warm anymore......just something to note if you're going to need Concierge assistance while visiting! Front Desk service was awesome on both stays, so go to them if you need assistance:) I will continue to stay here, as the lobby is lovely & spacious, the rooms & cuisine are great & the front desk is lovely. Best, Patrick Winkler New York, NY US

Reviews.Title: “Ideal luxury city center hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: hotelrate
Reviews.Content: Visited Chicago for some Christmas shopping and this was our base for three nights. It was simply beautiful, one of the nicest city center hotels I have ever stayed in. Very plush and luxurious. Our room was small enough but we had an amazing view and large windows. The bed was incredibly comfortable, and there was adequate space in the room for my purchases... just! Breakfast was divine, out of this world, wonderful service. All the frills you'd expect from a hotel like this. We had food there another evening and that was gorgeous too. Fantastic location for exploring Chicago and a stone's throw from Michigan Avenue and all the shops that line it. I would definitely recommend, and would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Best experience ever”
Reviews.Author: joelfranceusa
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, very helpfull staff, a real luxury hotel..........., good place to go before christmas, cross the street you have Saks, Neiman Marcus, Burberry etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not”
Reviews.Author: TravelCuties
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in October. Begrudgingly give it 4/5. The room was very nice, the bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom was enormous with comfy robes. Just didn't live up to either Ritz or Four Seasons standards. Shower handle came off in my hand, reception could not deal with multiple reservations (took four phone calls and in-person discussions to address), and housekeeping refused to take no for an answer (that one was three phone calls before I was kicked out of my room for cleaning). Limited bandwidth internet is complimentary. Good location for shopping on Michigan Avenue. Would only stay here again if we couldn't do the Four Seasons or Peninsula. Or stay at a less expensive hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel - Amazing for adults and kids too!”
Reviews.Author: newyorklila
Reviews.Content: We are just back from a fabulous stay at the Ritz Four Seasons in Chicago. I was traveling for a conference, but my husband and five month old daughter also came with me. The staff was amazingly accommodating for our baby. They brought up a crib, small refrigerator, and hot water kettle. They also had a perfect loaner stroller for us to use. All at no charge. Of course paying what you do to stay there, you'd expect no charge. The service was excellent. I've never walked into a hotel lobby and felt underdressed but every time I walked through the lobby I felt I looked so frumpy compared with the fellow guests. Top rate hotel and made traveling with a baby very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but not great value”
Reviews.Author: dik_10
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel well situated for Chicago's main attractions. Our suite on the 22nd floor was large and very comfortable with an outstanding view over the lake. However, there are a couple of imperfections that detract from what should have been a uniformally great experience. One was the shower - for $800 a night I expect (a) a separate shower cubicle and (b) more than the trickle of water that emanates from these showers. The other was the painfully slow and inaccurate breakfast service from waiters and a kitchen that are clearly overstretched. We never managed to complete breakfast in less than 50 minutes, which if we had been on business would have been a major issue. As a result (and because the restaurant is in the lobby, which I hate) we did not eat dinner there. Overall, I would stay here again, but not for the price I paid!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Weezer107
Reviews.Content: I had an amazing stay at the Ritz Carlton. The service was incredible! The food was kinda pricy, but it was good. There is a apple store near and a American girl right next to the ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful luxury Hotel unfortunately lacking good consistent service”
Reviews.Author: Bermuda2010
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room overlooking the lake! The large flat screen was positioned right in the middle of the beautiful view though :( . Great location on Michigan Ave by Watertower. Very pretty lobby and bar area, once you go up the elevator to the 12th floor. You must take another elevator to reach rooms. Front desk staff were friendly and professional, but did not follow through on requests.Other staff were unprofessional and many lack understanding of the English language.Yes this was Chicago.Concierge was helpful and friendly. Horrible perfumed amenities, please switch to unscented or natural. Bad service at restaurant, waitress disappeared.Food oddly was EXTREMELY over salted and over peppered (black pepper).Green salad entree was truly inedible and sent back twice (never have I sent food back twice, but I was hungry and you really could not even take a bite of it-and I like spicy food). We were one of 3 tables at restaurant and staff was busy setting up for next meal, and no one but our waitress spoke English. Request for removal of down and feathers from room due to allergies was not done, though this was confirmed at check in. A man who barely spoke English was sent to change pillows and disputed comforter was down until I pulled out a feather to show him. Very unprofessional and inhospitable. Spa and pool area had many young (under 5 years) visitors on the Sunday we arrived. Not very relaxing, maybe it was a special event?

Reviews.Title: “A+”
Reviews.Author: i_love_europe_35
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a good location, everything excellent. Totally enjoyed this property.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Ninkasi
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a conference, and it was fine for that. I found it a bit inconvenient to travel to the 12th floor each time as that was where the lobby was. Service was adequate.Two things struck me (both minor!) - the shower has only one strength setting - full on! Not very relaxing and clearly minimising water consumption / energy is not a focus of this hotel chain. The other is the breakfast format which is menu service only rather than buffet which is common in most countries outside of the USA. My wife had juice, cereal, toast and coffee and this cost $35 - not good value in my opinion. I would look for another hotel if I was to visit Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and quiet, but a little lacking in personality”
Reviews.Author: Luv2travelOzzie
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, well maintained, excellent service as you expect with Four Seasons. Really well located. Only issue is that the hotel seems to lack any atmosphere, especially in the lobby and the restaurant is very "hotel lobby restaurant". I think they could do better if they wanted to, For business though. An A-plus. Might be useful to note that "free" internet is very slow so you end up having to pay $8.50 for a higher speed in order to do anything but search the web slowly, If you need to access emails etc or download or upload pictures, then you can't use the free service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Guiche
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend at the Chicago Ritz-Carlton in July. The suite we booked was larger than expected, with a nice view of the city and the lake. The rollaway bed we requested was not there when we checked in, but the housekeeping promptly brought in after I called. The bathroom was huge as well, with lots of counter space and storage, including a separate closet. The lâ€™Occitane bath product was a nice touch. There was also a set of kidâ€™s bath product. The fixtures needed updating. The hot/cold dial in the shower was confusing and it took a long time for the water to get hot. The toy wagon was okay, but the cookie baking class was a big hit! My 4-year-old was the only â€œapprenticeâ€� that day. He got to see the inside of a real commercial kitchen as well as work with a real chef. Once the cookie had been baked, it was brought to our room with icing and sprinkles for him to decorate. There is a playground directly across the hotel. The Hershey store is on the other side of the Michigan Ave. Both are great to keep a 4-year-old entertained. We bought the tickets to the John Hancock Tower from the concierge. There was a 20% discount but most importantly â€“ no need to wait in line. There is also a tourism office across the street, great for maps and other info. We checked out on a Tuesday morning. It took 15 minutes for the bellhop to get to our room, but the rest of the checkout went very smoothly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Migizi
Reviews.Content: So, its the Ritz, and you expect a lot. We got in on a group rate for a wedding, so the price was very reasonable ($139). At that rate, the hotel was phenomenal. On the other hand, if you pay street rate on a busy weekend and its more like $400, Its decent but not spectacular. Details... THE GOOD --Room was spacious, well-appointed (though a bit worn in a few places), comfy bed, nice lake views, very nice bathroom --Customer service was up to Ritz's reputation - excellent --Bar and common areas very nice --Turndown service is always a nice bonus --Location in the heart of Streeterville is great THE BAD --Breakfast at the little cafe in the main lobby was overpriced, but decent --Valet parking was exorbitant ($45 a night) Overall, I'd say if you can get a competitive rate to other local hotels, go for it! If not, you might get a bit more for your money elsewhere. But you won't be disappointed in this hotel in any case.

Reviews.Title: “If you can stay here, do.”
Reviews.Author: ohiominstrel
Reviews.Content: Not every Ritz Carlton is a Ritz Carlton in spirit, service, luxury, comfort. This is one is. The Peninsula is another beauty in this Michigan Ave area, but I am now officially sold on this one. If you can spring for a lake view on a pretty day, you think you have fallen l in love with Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “there is nothing better than this lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: mavis-too
Reviews.Content: our travel was for business and leisure. we are continually grateful and happy to stay at this hotel each and every time. the most important qualities to me are: how very clean and sharp the guest rooms are, and the knowledge, kindness and consideration of the whole staff, especially the concierge. kuddos to jon winke, venke howe, laurel gray, richard augusta, and melissa long. thank you thank you thank you for making the ritz the place to stay in chicago. i recommend this ritz to everyone going to chicago all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Still the one”
Reviews.Author: pillowsofwanderlust
Reviews.Content: The Ritz has been our go-to hotel in Chicago for a number of years. Despite some minor slips for this visit, it's still the one we consider first when planning a trip to the Windy City. We come to Chicago almost annually, but somehow missed last year. As it turns out, we also missed the Ritz's entire remodeling phase where first the rooms and then the public areas were redone. The lobby apparently reopened less than a month before our visit. The rooms, previously a pleasant but busy cacophony of floral prints, are now a more subdued and contemporary palette of blue-gray. The bathrooms were redone previously and are unchanged. The rooms now boast a large desk with ergonomic chair and a console with drawers, and shelves that house the electronic safe and DVD player (the old safes that needed a key to open are still situated in the closet). The new large flat screen, high def TV sits on top. The windows now have a sunscreen as well as block-out drapes. There are interesting architectural photos in both the rooms and public areas. Minor changes that perhaps reflect the current economy: the bar of soap for the shower is the same size as the one for the sink (it used to be larger), there are fewer complimentary newspaper choices offered (Chicago Tribune and Wall Street Journal only, before there also was USA Today and New York Times), the room service menu has an all-day section rather than separate lunch and dinner menus. At first glance, the lobby appears unchanged, but upon closer inspection we realize the marble around the fountain has been replaced, as has the carpeting, now also marble. The former Cafe restaurant is now called Deca, with a private dining room in the Cafe's former entryway. The Greenhouse Lounge under the skylight is now the Deca Bar. There is new furniture throughout. Deca has a French bistro menu--we dined there one evening and it was quite good. Like the Cafe before it, it never seems too crowded. The Greenhouse served a fabulous weekend brunch that for now is no longer offered at Deca, but the hostess said it may soon return. The hotel's strongest attribute has always been its service. Four Seasons standards and Midwestern friendliness combine to great effect here. The concierges are particularly helpful; we recognized many familiar faces. When we checked in around 8am after a red-eye flight, a room was not immediately available, so we went to the spa to shower and freshen up. I ran into the same outgoing local resident (a spa member) from my last visit, who loves to greet new guests and give impromptu tours of the facilities. At least this time he was a bit further along in his routine--he was wearing briefs, whereas last time he was nude. We were contacted by phone around 10:30 saying our room was ready, but we then discovered it didn't have the southern view we prefer. We were immediately moved to another room on the same floor with the desired view, but were not informed, as we should have been, that this room was smaller-- a Moderate vs. a Deluxe. We opted to stay in this room and it was fine--it had all the same furnishings and we actually preferred the bathroom, which was one large room with a single sink, rather than the split bath in the Deluxe rooms with a large double sink area, but a cramped toilet/shower/tub area. As always, we chose to take the CTA subway from O'Hare, a cheap ($2.25) 45 minute ride that ends about 3 blocks from the hotel. There are four stairways and a transfer involved, however. The American Girl store that used to be below the nearby Peninsula Hotel is now in an even larger space in Water Tower Place just below the Ritz, only an elevator ride away. We love the hotel's location just off the Magnificent Mile, and as always, we visited the Museum of Contemporary Art across the street and gawked at the landmark Mies van der Rohe apartments on Lake Shore Drive a few blocks away. We discovered Mies' own apartment was in a building across the street from the Ritz. I'll admit we actually split our hotels for this visit and tried the James as well as the Ritz. We had also heard nice things about the new Elysian. Plus there are the well regarded Peninsula, Park Hyatt, Trump Tower and Four Seasons hotels. But I don't think we'll ever completely shun the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Good not Great!”
Reviews.Author: gwhite216
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Park Hyatt and do to recent renovations we decided to give the Ritz a try. I checked in on Friday night around 8 pm. I took the elevator to the 12th floor lobby and headed to the desk. I waited to be acknowledged and was greeted by the staff. I was then handed 2 keys and escorted to the elevator. As I got on I was told they gave me a "smoking optional" room but it did not smell like smoke. It supposedly was the only room available as they were fully committed. I headed to the 19th floor and the whole floor smelled of smoke. As I entered the room a window was open to air out the smoke. I tried to call down but the phone did not work properly. I went back down to the desk and explained my wife is pregnant and a smoking room would not be acceptable. I then waited 10 minutes as the reservationist and manager to switch our room. We were placed on the 21st floor. The room was nice but not spectacular. The 1st morning we did not receive a paper as requested. The bed was extremely comfortable. After check in it was a nice stay. I do not believe it lives up to the Four Seasons brand. I will go back to the Park Hyatt across the street next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: jonurso
Reviews.Content: We just spent a weekend at the Ritz. First the room and more importantly the bed was to die for!! Must buy that bed. The bathroom was an extremely nice hotel bathroom. The service in the entire hotel was great. The location was right where you want to be to see downtown Chicago and Navy Pier. The breakfast was pricey but was spectacular!! $90 for two.

Reviews.Title: “It't the Ritz.”
Reviews.Author: Taniquan
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in Water Tower Place. It is a solid 5 star hotel in a solid 5 star location. Everything is within walking distance-in fact most everything is within a few blocks i.e. Rush Street, Oak Street, and it is on Michigan Avenue marking the beginning of the Magnificent Mile. It is a true five star facility. And it offers free wifi internet! The restaurant is under construction so it is somewhat limited now but that should not matter when outside your door are some of the countryâ€™s best steak houses such as Dobsonâ€™s and Ditkaâ€™s (yes THAT Ditka) Everything about is was great including them allowing me to check in at 10 am for my 6 night stay. My room was spacious, the toiletries first class, and the view spectacular. I would highly recommend this hotel to others. The other true 5 star hotel in Chicago is the Peninsula which is only about 2 blocks away and Trump Tower which is at the other end of the Magnificent Mile . I have also stayed in both of these hotels and fouls them both to be equally lavish, with the Peninsula being somewhat more so. Trump Tower is fine but it is in a different location which is really not waling distance to the Rush Street nightlife scene although it would be just a short cab ride. The Peninsula and Ritz are basically in the same location. Bottom line is that it is 5 star luxury in the best location in Chicago. No Complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Badly outdated and overpriced rooms”
Reviews.Author: playfulpuppy47
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Battery Park,N.Y. It was everything a 5 star should be. Chicago was everything a 3 star should be at double or triple the price. The bathroom fixtures were out-of-date, the room was only one step above a Holiday Inn and the room amenities were none existent. It was a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “What a hotel... magnificent!!”
Reviews.Author: mhar8453
Reviews.Content: this hotel is in the absolute best hotel i've stayed at. The hotel is literally connected to the water tower place (huge shopping mall), all you have to do is take the elevator to the second floor and your there!!!!. their pool is amazing, goes to 10 feet, and the sauna was also a plus. The staff were not only willing to help us on any thing we asked about, but was eager to help us and to make sure we were enjoying our stay.Oh yeah... the hotel is right on michigan avenue... just great!! it honestly couldn't have gotten any better. If you value a clean, spacious, excellent customer service hotel, then i recommend this hotel.. and even if you dont value those characteristics, i still recommend this hotel to you..!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best!”
Reviews.Author: travellots100
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt, this is one of the best hotels to be found anywhere. I was warmly welcomed by the Valet, extended one of the fastest check-in experiences anywhere, escorted to the elevator, and whisked up to a luxury suite with panoramic windows on all sides overlooking the lake. A few minutes after arrival in the suite, while unpacking, a knock on the door brought a gentleman who set up a complimentary display of water, fruit, cheese, and crackers in the suite dining area. Classy! The suite was immaculate, kept well stocked with amenities, and I slept like a baby the entire stay (three nights). Concierge service was "world-class" with many excellent suggestions regarding dining. A tip ... travel down the elevator to the mall and try the "Mity Nice" (that's the name) restaurant! Great food and extremely reasonable prices. I can't wait for my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet..........”
Reviews.Author: josiewales
Reviews.Content: Love, love love. Could be that we were in a newly remodeled room or that we were celebraing an anniversary but what a great place. Location is awesome and the bar rocks. Must stay there whenever we go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice changes in the rooms, disappointing changes in service. Avoid until renovations are complete (5/10).”
Reviews.Author: julesagogo
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Ritz-Carlton maybe a dozen times and have always had a lovely experience until now. The service has always been excellent, the hotel is quiet and elegant, and the location can't be beat (I'm not a big shopper, but since I always seem to forget some item of clothing when I travel, the fact that it is attached to Water Tower Place is a huge plus). Most often I'm there for a relaxing weekend with my husband and we stay in the Anniversary Suite. We were pleased to find on our visit over the New Year holidays that the suite, whose decor had been pretty dated (floral upholstery and botanical prints), had been renovated with a modern pewter and purple color scheme and almost entirely new furniture. Also new were flat-panel TVs and sun-blocking window shades. We did find. though, that the living area of the suite seemed rather sparse. When the surprised bellman remarked that it was missing several pieces of furniture, maybe it should have tipped us off to an inattention to detail that was repeated throughout our stay. Our complaints: -A few of the things we love about the hotel (and that set it apart from competitors) are its bright and spacious lobby with a cafe and lounge area that are perfect for regrouping (high tea is also served there, if you're into that), and its dining room which hosts a fantastic brunch on Sundays and some holidays. We weren't informed when we reserved that all of these are being renovated and are closed until May, and it was an unwelcome surprise to find this out upon arrival. When we complained, we were told that the decision not to inform guests of the renovations was a deliberate one that was made at the corporate level. It's hard to blame the property for a corporate decision, but regardless, for repeat guests it was a bait and switch. -We're used to top-notch, five star service at the Ritz Carlton, and this time we didn't get it. We used the normally excellent laundry service and didn't receive our clothes until hours after they were promised, and only after calling for them. Room service breakfast that was promised within 55 minutes (too long a wait in any case) didn't arrive within 90 minutes, when we canceled and received a weak apology before heading across the street to the Peninsula (which was hosting a brunch comparable to the one we couldn't get at the Ritz). We were happy with management's response when made aware of these problems (comping us a breakfast and promising a room upgrade on our next stay), and as a result we'll probably give the Ritz another shot after the renovations are complete. But, with many hotels in the same class close by, the Ritz needs to step it up to keep our business.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz slipped - a little.”
Reviews.Author: jrbengt
Reviews.Content: My wife & I checked into the Ritz on Dec. 20 for a 3 night stay. We were given a nice room on a high floor, with a great view of Navy Pier & the Water Tower. Unfortunately, the hotel decided to start a massive renovation of the entire reception floor on the first day of our stay. The huge sitting area was closed off with black curtains. No explanations or apologies were offered. This isn't what I expected from a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service and Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: luw718
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Ritz-Carlton for three nights on a business trip. I informed the attendant during check-in that it was my first time in Chicago and was immediately upgraded to a Deluxe room with a view on a high floor from a Superior room. The service was unobtrusive and thoughtful with prompt and excellent in-room dining. The concierge had a ready list of restaurants to recommend and offered VIP lists to reduce wait time. The hotel was a little dated and the room showed some age despite having an LCD TV. The bathroom had a bathtub and shower combination and was a bit small compared to others in its class. There was an excellent pool and fitness center but closes fairly early. The lobby, as with a few other major hotels in the city, was situated on a higher floor, to cut off the riffraff. It was still fairly quick to reach one's room by taking two elevators. Overall, an excellent hotel with superb service and centrally located in the shopping district.

Reviews.Title: “What you'd expect from a "mutant" Four Seasons-Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: SFTraveler555
Reviews.Content: It's confusing branding, but it's pretty much what you'd expect. Nearly obsequious service, but not quite. Nice setting. Very clean and well maintained rooms. Quiet. Food is excellent in room service and restaurants. Very nice views from nearly every room. Possible to get good rates that make it possible to stay here for business.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding -- and (surprisingly) a Real Value!”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Pro55
Reviews.Content: One up side of the down economy is that savvy travelers can enjoy some real bargains. My wife and I recently took advantage of a significant deal offered by The Ritz-Carlton Chicago. The hotel was offering a credit (read: discount!) of $100 per night for guests who stayed a minimum of two nights. Because we planned to drive from Indianapolis after work on Friday anyway, it was perfect: the luxury of the Ritz-Carlton for a room rate of about $25 a night more than we would have spent on a much more modest hotel at the other end of the Magnificent Mile. The service was impeccable. From the bellman who greeted us and took our luggage to our room to the desk clerks, the concierge, and room service attendants, everything was top-flight. The hotel is located in Water Tower Place, kitty-corner from the famous Chicago water tower, across from the John Hancock Building, and adjacent to a shopping mall with the store my wife refers to as her â€œmother shipâ€�: Macyâ€™s. (Try the Frango mints; theyâ€™re a true Chicago treat!) Our room, 2222, was a Deluxe room and included a king bed, easy chair, desk, big-screen TV, huge closet, and a minibar. The room faced south with what real estate agents would describe as a â€œpeek viewâ€� of Lake Michigan and Navy Pier, but had shades and curtains that kept the morning sun at bay until we were ready to greet it. The bath was quite large with double sinks; a separate tub and toilet area; generous, fluffy towels; a hair dryer; lighted makeup mirror; robes and slippers; and high-end Lâ€™Occitane en Provence amenities. Lounging about in bathrobes, reading the paper, and sipping coffee is a great way to start the day so, on Saturday morning, we decided to treat ourselves to room service. The French Country breakfast consisted of assorted, cured meats and cheeses, artisan bread, a croissant, citrus mostarda, cafÃ© au lait, and brewed coffee. It was delivered within 1/2 hour of our call and was delicious! Thus fortified, we got ready to head out onto the Magnificent Mile and enjoy some surprisingly glorious November weather. After a day spent doing a little shopping and a lot of wandering through art galleries along the Mag Mile and in the cityâ€™s River North neighborhood, we were ready for a nice dinner. Chicago is also home to a number of wonderful dining spots, many are within easy walking distance of the Ritz-Carlton. While my wife and I thoroughly enjoy fine food and arenâ€™t hesitant about paying for it, some of the trendier spots in the area seemed to smack of a â€œpopularity premium,â€� so we asked one of the concierge staff for other recommendations. The concierge, a member of Les Clef dâ€™Or, recommended a new Mexican restaurant that opened on Kinzie Street in September, just a short cab ride from the hotel. Thereâ€™s a lot to do in Chicago, from shopping and sightseeing when the weather is good to a broad range of museums, theatres, and other indoor attractions when the weather is bad. I highly recommend considering The Ritz-Carlton as your base of operations, no matter what the weather!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Salthillhalli
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz Carlton Chicago after attending a meeting at the Westin Michigan Avenue. Thankfully I stayed at the RC after the Westin and not before. Where the Westin was tired with service lacking the RC was a breath of fresh air.
